scene: SCENE I.  Troy. Before Priam's palace.
speaker: TROILUS
line: Call here my varlet; I'll unarm again:

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. Before Priam's palace.
speaker: TROILUS
line: Why should I war without the walls of Troy,

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. Before Priam's palace.
speaker: TROILUS
line: That find such cruel battle here within?

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. Before Priam's palace.
speaker: TROILUS
line: Each Trojan that is master of his heart,

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. Before Priam's palace.
speaker: TROILUS
line: Let him to field; Troilus, alas! hath none.

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. Before Priam's palace.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: Will this gear ne'er be mended?

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. Before Priam's palace.
speaker: TROILUS
line: The Greeks are strong and skilful to their strength,

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. Before Priam's palace.
speaker: TROILUS
line: Fierce to their skill and to their fierceness valiant;

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. Before Priam's palace.
speaker: TROILUS
line: But I am weaker than a woman's tear,

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. Before Priam's palace.
speaker: TROILUS
line: Tamer than sleep, fonder than ignorance,

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. Before Priam's palace.
speaker: TROILUS
line: Less valiant than the virgin in the night

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. Before Priam's palace.
speaker: TROILUS
line: And skilless as unpractised infancy.

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. Before Priam's palace.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: Well, I have told you enough of this: for my part,

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. Before Priam's palace.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: I'll not meddle nor make no further. He that will

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. Before Priam's palace.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: have a cake out of the wheat must needs tarry the grinding.

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. Before Priam's palace.
speaker: TROILUS
line: Have I not tarried?

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. Before Priam's palace.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: Ay, the grinding; but you must tarry

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. Before Priam's palace.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: the bolting.

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. Before Priam's palace.
speaker: TROILUS
line: Have I not tarried?

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. Before Priam's palace.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: Ay, the bolting, but you must tarry the leavening.

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. Before Priam's palace.
speaker: TROILUS
line: Still have I tarried.

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. Before Priam's palace.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: Ay, to the leavening; but here's yet in the word

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. Before Priam's palace.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: 'hereafter' the kneading, the making of the cake, the

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. Before Priam's palace.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: heating of the oven and the baking; nay, you must

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. Before Priam's palace.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: stay the cooling too, or you may chance to burn your lips.

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. Before Priam's palace.
speaker: TROILUS
line: Patience herself, what goddess e'er she be,

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. Before Priam's palace.
speaker: TROILUS
line: Doth lesser blench at sufferance than I do.

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. Before Priam's palace.
speaker: TROILUS
line: At Priam's royal table do I sit;

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. Before Priam's palace.
speaker: TROILUS
line: And when fair Cressid comes into my thoughts,--

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. Before Priam's palace.
speaker: TROILUS
line: So, traitor! 'When she comes!' When is she thence?

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. Before Priam's palace.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: Well, she looked yesternight fairer than ever I saw

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. Before Priam's palace.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: her look, or any woman else.

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. Before Priam's palace.
speaker: TROILUS
line: I was about to tell thee:--when my heart,

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. Before Priam's palace.
speaker: TROILUS
line: As wedged with a sigh, would rive in twain,

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. Before Priam's palace.
speaker: TROILUS
line: Lest Hector or my father should perceive me,

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. Before Priam's palace.
speaker: TROILUS
line: I have, as when the sun doth light a storm,

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. Before Priam's palace.
speaker: TROILUS
line: Buried this sigh in wrinkle of a smile:

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. Before Priam's palace.
speaker: TROILUS
line: But sorrow, that is couch'd in seeming gladness,

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. Before Priam's palace.
speaker: TROILUS
line: Is like that mirth fate turns to sudden sadness.

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. Before Priam's palace.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: An her hair were not somewhat darker than Helen's--

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. Before Priam's palace.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: well, go to--there were no more comparison between

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. Before Priam's palace.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: the women: but, for my part, she is my kinswoman; I

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. Before Priam's palace.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: would not, as they term it, praise her: but I would

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. Before Priam's palace.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: somebody had heard her talk yesterday, as I did. I

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. Before Priam's palace.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: will not dispraise your sister Cassandra's wit, but--

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. Before Priam's palace.
speaker: TROILUS
line: O Pandarus! I tell thee, Pandarus,--

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. Before Priam's palace.
speaker: TROILUS
line: When I do tell thee, there my hopes lie drown'd,

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. Before Priam's palace.
speaker: TROILUS
line: Reply not in how many fathoms deep

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. Before Priam's palace.
speaker: TROILUS
line: They lie indrench'd. I tell thee I am mad

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. Before Priam's palace.
speaker: TROILUS
line: In Cressid's love: thou answer'st 'she is fair;'

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. Before Priam's palace.
speaker: TROILUS
line: Pour'st in the open ulcer of my heart

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. Before Priam's palace.
speaker: TROILUS
line: Her eyes, her hair, her cheek, her gait, her voice,

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. Before Priam's palace.
speaker: TROILUS
line: Handlest in thy discourse, O, that her hand,

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. Before Priam's palace.
speaker: TROILUS
line: In whose comparison all whites are ink,

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. Before Priam's palace.
speaker: TROILUS
line: Writing their own reproach, to whose soft seizure

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. Before Priam's palace.
speaker: TROILUS
line: The cygnet's down is harsh and spirit of sense

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. Before Priam's palace.
speaker: TROILUS
line: Hard as the palm of ploughman: this thou tell'st me,

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. Before Priam's palace.
speaker: TROILUS
line: As true thou tell'st me, when I say I love her;

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. Before Priam's palace.
speaker: TROILUS
line: But, saying thus, instead of oil and balm,

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. Before Priam's palace.
speaker: TROILUS
line: Thou lay'st in every gash that love hath given me

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. Before Priam's palace.
speaker: TROILUS
line: The knife that made it.

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. Before Priam's palace.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: I speak no more than truth.

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. Before Priam's palace.
speaker: TROILUS
line: Thou dost not speak so much.

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. Before Priam's palace.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: Faith, I'll not meddle in't. Let her be as she is:

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. Before Priam's palace.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: if she be fair, 'tis the better for her; an she be

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. Before Priam's palace.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: not, she has the mends in her own hands.

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. Before Priam's palace.
speaker: TROILUS
line: Good Pandarus, how now, Pandarus!

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. Before Priam's palace.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: I have had my labour for my travail; ill-thought on of

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. Before Priam's palace.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: her and ill-thought on of you; gone between and

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. Before Priam's palace.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: between, but small thanks for my labour.

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. Before Priam's palace.
speaker: TROILUS
line: What, art thou angry, Pandarus? what, with me?

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. Before Priam's palace.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: Because she's kin to me, therefore she's not so fair

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. Before Priam's palace.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: as Helen: an she were not kin to me, she would be as

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. Before Priam's palace.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: fair on Friday as Helen is on Sunday. But what care

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. Before Priam's palace.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: I? I care not an she were a black-a-moor; 'tis all one to me.

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. Before Priam's palace.
speaker: TROILUS
line: Say I she is not fair?

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. Before Priam's palace.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: I do not care whether you do or no. She's a fool to

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. Before Priam's palace.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: stay behind her father; let her to the Greeks; and so

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. Before Priam's palace.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: I'll tell her the next time I see her: for my part,

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. Before Priam's palace.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: I'll meddle nor make no more i' the matter.

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. Before Priam's palace.
speaker: TROILUS
line: Pandarus,--

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. Before Priam's palace.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: Not I.

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. Before Priam's palace.
speaker: TROILUS
line: Sweet Pandarus,--

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. Before Priam's palace.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: Pray you, speak no more to me: I will leave all as I

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. Before Priam's palace.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: found it, and there an end.

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. Before Priam's palace.
speaker: TROILUS
line: Peace, you ungracious clamours! peace, rude sounds!

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. Before Priam's palace.
speaker: TROILUS
line: Fools on both sides! Helen must needs be fair,

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. Before Priam's palace.
speaker: TROILUS
line: When with your blood you daily paint her thus.

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. Before Priam's palace.
speaker: TROILUS
line: I cannot fight upon this argument;

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. Before Priam's palace.
speaker: TROILUS
line: It is too starved a subject for my sword.

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. Before Priam's palace.
speaker: TROILUS
line: But Pandarus,--O gods, how do you plague me!

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. Before Priam's palace.
speaker: TROILUS
line: I cannot come to Cressid but by Pandar;

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. Before Priam's palace.
speaker: TROILUS
line: And he's as tetchy to be woo'd to woo.

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. Before Priam's palace.
speaker: TROILUS
line: As she is stubborn-chaste against all suit.

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. Before Priam's palace.
speaker: TROILUS
line: Tell me, Apollo, for thy Daphne's love,

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. Before Priam's palace.
speaker: TROILUS
line: What Cressid is, what Pandar, and what we?

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. Before Priam's palace.
speaker: TROILUS
line: Her bed is India; there she lies, a pearl:

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. Before Priam's palace.
speaker: TROILUS
line: Between our Ilium and where she resides,

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. Before Priam's palace.
speaker: TROILUS
line: Let it be call'd the wild and wandering flood,

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. Before Priam's palace.
speaker: TROILUS
line: Ourself the merchant, and this sailing Pandar

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. Before Priam's palace.
speaker: TROILUS
line: Our doubtful hope, our convoy and our bark.

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. Before Priam's palace.
speaker: AENEAS
line: How now, Prince Troilus! wherefore not afield?

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. Before Priam's palace.
speaker: TROILUS
line: Because not there: this woman's answer sorts,

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. Before Priam's palace.
speaker: TROILUS
line: For womanish it is to be from thence.

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. Before Priam's palace.
speaker: TROILUS
line: What news, AEneas, from the field to-day?

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. Before Priam's palace.
speaker: AENEAS
line: That Paris is returned home and hurt.

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. Before Priam's palace.
speaker: TROILUS
line: By whom, AEneas?

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. Before Priam's palace.
speaker: AENEAS
line: Troilus, by Menelaus.

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. Before Priam's palace.
speaker: TROILUS
line: Let Paris bleed; 'tis but a scar to scorn;

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. Before Priam's palace.
speaker: TROILUS
line: Paris is gored with Menelaus' horn.

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. Before Priam's palace.
speaker: AENEAS
line: Hark, what good sport is out of town to-day!

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. Before Priam's palace.
speaker: TROILUS
line: Better at home, if 'would I might' were 'may.'

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. Before Priam's palace.
speaker: TROILUS
line: But to the sport abroad: are you bound thither?

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. Before Priam's palace.
speaker: AENEAS
line: In all swift haste.

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. Before Priam's palace.
speaker: TROILUS
line: Come, go we then together.

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: CRESSIDA
line: Who were those went by?

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: ALEXANDER
line: Queen Hecuba and Helen.

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: CRESSIDA
line: And whither go they?

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: ALEXANDER
line: Up to the eastern tower,

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: ALEXANDER
line: Whose height commands as subject all the vale,

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: ALEXANDER
line: To see the battle. Hector, whose patience

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: ALEXANDER
line: Is, as a virtue, fix'd, to-day was moved:

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: ALEXANDER
line: He chid Andromache and struck his armourer,

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: ALEXANDER
line: And, like as there were husbandry in war,

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: ALEXANDER
line: Before the sun rose he was harness'd light,

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: ALEXANDER
line: And to the field goes he; where every flower

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: ALEXANDER
line: Did, as a prophet, weep what it foresaw

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: ALEXANDER
line: In Hector's wrath.

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: CRESSIDA
line: What was his cause of anger?

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: ALEXANDER
line: The noise goes, this: there is among the Greeks

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: ALEXANDER
line: A lord of Trojan blood, nephew to Hector;

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: ALEXANDER
line: They call him Ajax.

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: CRESSIDA
line: Good; and what of him?

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: ALEXANDER
line: They say he is a very man per se,

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: ALEXANDER
line: And stands alone.

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: CRESSIDA
line: So do all men, unless they are drunk, sick, or have no legs.

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: ALEXANDER
line: This man, lady, hath robbed many beasts of their

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: ALEXANDER
line: particular additions; he is as valiant as the lion,

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: ALEXANDER
line: churlish as the bear, slow as the elephant: a man

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: ALEXANDER
line: into whom nature hath so crowded humours that his

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: ALEXANDER
line: valour is crushed into folly, his folly sauced with

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: ALEXANDER
line: discretion: there is no man hath a virtue that he

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: ALEXANDER
line: hath not a glimpse of, nor any man an attaint but he

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: ALEXANDER
line: carries some stain of it: he is melancholy without

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: ALEXANDER
line: cause, and merry against the hair: he hath the

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: ALEXANDER
line: joints of every thing, but everything so out of joint

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: ALEXANDER
line: that he is a gouty Briareus, many hands and no use,

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: ALEXANDER
line: or purblind Argus, all eyes and no sight.

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: CRESSIDA
line: But how should this man, that makes

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: CRESSIDA
line: me smile, make Hector angry?

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: ALEXANDER
line: They say he yesterday coped Hector in the battle and

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: ALEXANDER
line: struck him down, the disdain and shame whereof hath

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: ALEXANDER
line: ever since kept Hector fasting and waking.

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: CRESSIDA
line: Who comes here?

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: ALEXANDER
line: Madam, your uncle Pandarus.

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: CRESSIDA
line: Hector's a gallant man.

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: ALEXANDER
line: As may be in the world, lady.

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: What's that? what's that?

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: CRESSIDA
line: Good morrow, uncle Pandarus.

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: Good morrow, cousin Cressid: what do you talk of?

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: Good morrow, Alexander. How do you, cousin? When

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: were you at Ilium?

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: CRESSIDA
line: This morning, uncle.

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: What were you talking of when I came? Was Hector

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: armed and gone ere ye came to Ilium? Helen was not

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: up, was she?

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: CRESSIDA
line: Hector was gone, but Helen was not up.

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: Even so: Hector was stirring early.

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: CRESSIDA
line: That were we talking of, and of his anger.

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: Was he angry?

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: CRESSIDA
line: So he says here.

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: True, he was so: I know the cause too: he'll lay

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: about him to-day, I can tell them that: and there's

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: Troilus will not come far behind him: let them take

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: heed of Troilus, I can tell them that too.

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: CRESSIDA
line: What, is he angry too?

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: Who, Troilus? Troilus is the better man of the two.

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: CRESSIDA
line: O Jupiter! there's no comparison.

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: What, not between Troilus and Hector? Do you know a

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: man if you see him?

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: CRESSIDA
line: Ay, if I ever saw him before and knew him.

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: Well, I say Troilus is Troilus.

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: CRESSIDA
line: Then you say as I say; for, I am sure, he is not Hector.

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: No, nor Hector is not Troilus in some degrees.

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: CRESSIDA
line: 'Tis just to each of them; he is himself.

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: Himself! Alas, poor Troilus! I would he were.

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: CRESSIDA
line: So he is.

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: Condition, I had gone barefoot to India.

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: CRESSIDA
line: He is not Hector.

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: Himself! no, he's not himself: would a' were

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: himself! Well, the gods are above; time must friend

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: or end: well, Troilus, well: I would my heart were

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: in her body. No, Hector is not a better man than Troilus.

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: CRESSIDA
line: Excuse me.

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: He is elder.

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: CRESSIDA
line: Pardon me, pardon me.

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: Th' other's not come to't; you shall tell me another

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: tale, when th' other's come to't. Hector shall not

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: have his wit this year.

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: CRESSIDA
line: He shall not need it, if he have his own.

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: Nor his qualities.

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: CRESSIDA
line: No matter.

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: Nor his beauty.

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: CRESSIDA
line: 'Twould not become him; his own's better.

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: You have no judgment, niece: Helen

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: herself swore th' other day, that Troilus, for

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: a brown favour--for so 'tis, I must confess,--

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: not brown neither,--

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: CRESSIDA
line: No, but brown.

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: 'Faith, to say truth, brown and not brown.

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: CRESSIDA
line: To say the truth, true and not true.

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: She praised his complexion above Paris.

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: CRESSIDA
line: Why, Paris hath colour enough.

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: So he has.

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: CRESSIDA
line: Then Troilus should have too much: if she praised

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: CRESSIDA
line: him above, his complexion is higher than his; he

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: CRESSIDA
line: having colour enough, and the other higher, is too

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: CRESSIDA
line: flaming a praise for a good complexion. I had as

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: CRESSIDA
line: lief Helen's golden tongue had commended Troilus for

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: CRESSIDA
line: a copper nose.

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: I swear to you. I think Helen loves him better than Paris.

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: CRESSIDA
line: Then she's a merry Greek indeed.

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: Nay, I am sure she does. She came to him th' other

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: day into the compassed window,--and, you know, he

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: has not past three or four hairs on his chin,--

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: CRESSIDA
line: Indeed, a tapster's arithmetic may soon bring his

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: CRESSIDA
line: particulars therein to a total.

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: Why, he is very young: and yet will he, within

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: three pound, lift as much as his brother Hector.

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: CRESSIDA
line: Is he so young a man and so old a lifter?

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: But to prove to you that Helen loves him: she came

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: and puts me her white hand to his cloven chin--

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: CRESSIDA
line: Juno have mercy! how came it cloven?

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: Why, you know 'tis dimpled: I think his smiling

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: becomes him better than any man in all Phrygia.

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: CRESSIDA
line: O, he smiles valiantly.

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: Does he not?

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: CRESSIDA
line: O yes, an 'twere a cloud in autumn.

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: Why, go to, then: but to prove to you that Helen

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: loves Troilus,--

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: CRESSIDA
line: Troilus will stand to the proof, if you'll

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: CRESSIDA
line: prove it so.

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: Troilus! why, he esteems her no more than I esteem

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: an addle egg.

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: CRESSIDA
line: If you love an addle egg as well as you love an idle

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: CRESSIDA
line: head, you would eat chickens i' the shell.

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: I cannot choose but laugh, to think how she tickled

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: his chin: indeed, she has a marvellous white hand, I

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: must needs confess,--

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: CRESSIDA
line: Without the rack.

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: And she takes upon her to spy a white hair on his chin.

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: CRESSIDA
line: Alas, poor chin! many a wart is richer.

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: But there was such laughing! Queen Hecuba laughed

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: that her eyes ran o'er.

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: CRESSIDA
line: With mill-stones.

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: And Cassandra laughed.

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: CRESSIDA
line: But there was more temperate fire under the pot of

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: CRESSIDA
line: her eyes: did her eyes run o'er too?

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: And Hector laughed.

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: CRESSIDA
line: At what was all this laughing?

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: Marry, at the white hair that Helen spied on Troilus' chin.

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: CRESSIDA
line: An't had been a green hair, I should have laughed

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: CRESSIDA
line: too.

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: They laughed not so much at the hair as at his pretty answer.

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: CRESSIDA
line: What was his answer?

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: Quoth she, 'Here's but two and fifty hairs on your

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: chin, and one of them is white.

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: CRESSIDA
line: This is her question.

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: That's true; make no question of that. 'Two and

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: fifty hairs' quoth he, 'and one white: that white

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: hair is my father, and all the rest are his sons.'

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: 'Jupiter!' quoth she, 'which of these hairs is Paris,

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: my husband? 'The forked one,' quoth he, 'pluck't

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: out, and give it him.' But there was such laughing!

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: and Helen so blushed, an Paris so chafed, and all the

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: rest so laughed, that it passed.

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: CRESSIDA
line: So let it now; for it has been while going by.

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: Well, cousin. I told you a thing yesterday; think on't.

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: CRESSIDA
line: So I do.

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: I'll be sworn 'tis true; he will weep you, an 'twere

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: a man born in April.

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: CRESSIDA
line: And I'll spring up in his tears, an 'twere a nettle

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: CRESSIDA
line: against May.

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: Hark! they are coming from the field: shall we

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: stand up here, and see them as they pass toward

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: Ilium? good niece, do, sweet niece Cressida.

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: CRESSIDA
line: At your pleasure.

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: Here, here, here's an excellent place; here we may

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: see most bravely: I'll tell you them all by their

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: names as they pass by; but mark Troilus above the rest.

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: CRESSIDA
line: Speak not so loud.

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: That's AEneas: is not that a brave man? he's one of

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: the flowers of Troy, I can tell you: but mark

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: Troilus; you shall see anon.

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: CRESSIDA
line: Who's that?

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: That's Antenor: he has a shrewd wit, I can tell you;

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: and he's a man good enough, he's one o' the soundest

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: judgments in whosoever, and a proper man of person.

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: When comes Troilus? I'll show you Troilus anon: if

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: he see me, you shall see him nod at me.

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: CRESSIDA
line: Will he give you the nod?

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: You shall see.

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: CRESSIDA
line: If he do, the rich shall have more.

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: That's Hector, that, that, look you, that; there's a

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: fellow! Go thy way, Hector! There's a brave man,

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: niece. O brave Hector! Look how he looks! there's

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: a countenance! is't not a brave man?

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: CRESSIDA
line: O, a brave man!

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: Is a' not? it does a man's heart good. Look you

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: what hacks are on his helmet! look you yonder, do

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: you see? look you there: there's no jesting;

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: there's laying on, take't off who will, as they say:

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: there be hacks!

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: CRESSIDA
line: Be those with swords?

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: Swords! any thing, he cares not; an the devil come

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: to him, it's all one: by God's lid, it does one's

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: heart good. Yonder comes Paris, yonder comes Paris.

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: Look ye yonder, niece; is't not a gallant man too,

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: is't not? Why, this is brave now. Who said he came

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: hurt home to-day? he's not hurt: why, this will do

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: Helen's heart good now, ha! Would I could see

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: Troilus now! You shall see Troilus anon.

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: CRESSIDA
line: Who's that?

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: That's Helenus. I marvel where Troilus is. That's

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: Helenus. I think he went not forth to-day. That's Helenus.

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: CRESSIDA
line: Can Helenus fight, uncle?

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: Helenus? no. Yes, he'll fight indifferent well. I

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: marvel where Troilus is. Hark! do you not hear the

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: people cry 'Troilus'? Helenus is a priest.

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: CRESSIDA
line: What sneaking fellow comes yonder?

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: Where? yonder? that's Deiphobus. 'Tis Troilus!

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: there's a man, niece! Hem! Brave Troilus! the

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: prince of chivalry!

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: CRESSIDA
line: Peace, for shame, peace!

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: Mark him; note him. O brave Troilus! Look well upon

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: him, niece: look you how his sword is bloodied, and

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: his helm more hacked than Hector's, and how he looks,

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: and how he goes! O admirable youth! he ne'er saw

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: three and twenty. Go thy way, Troilus, go thy way!

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: Had I a sister were a grace, or a daughter a goddess,

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: he should take his choice. O admirable man! Paris?

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: Paris is dirt to him; and, I warrant, Helen, to

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: change, would give an eye to boot.

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: CRESSIDA
line: Here come more.

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: Asses, fools, dolts! chaff and bran, chaff and bran!

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: porridge after meat! I could live and die i' the

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: eyes of Troilus. Ne'er look, ne'er look: the eagles

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: are gone: crows and daws, crows and daws! I had

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: rather be such a man as Troilus than Agamemnon and

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: all Greece.

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: CRESSIDA
line: There is among the Greeks Achilles, a better man than Troilus.

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: Achilles! a drayman, a porter, a very camel.

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: CRESSIDA
line: Well, well.

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: 'Well, well!' why, have you any discretion? have

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: you any eyes? Do you know what a man is? Is not

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: birth, beauty, good shape, discourse, manhood,

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: learning, gentleness, virtue, youth, liberality,

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: and such like, the spice and salt that season a man?

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: CRESSIDA
line: Ay, a minced man: and then to be baked with no date

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: CRESSIDA
line: in the pie, for then the man's date's out.

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: You are such a woman! one knows not at what ward you

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: lie.

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: CRESSIDA
line: Upon my back, to defend my belly; upon my wit, to

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: CRESSIDA
line: defend my wiles; upon my secrecy, to defend mine

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: CRESSIDA
line: honesty; my mask, to defend my beauty; and you, to

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: CRESSIDA
line: defend all these: and at all these wards I lie, at a

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: CRESSIDA
line: thousand watches.

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: Say one of your watches.

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: CRESSIDA
line: Nay, I'll watch you for that; and that's one of the

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: CRESSIDA
line: chiefest of them too: if I cannot ward what I would

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: CRESSIDA
line: not have hit, I can watch you for telling how I took

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: CRESSIDA
line: the blow; unless it swell past hiding, and then it's

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: CRESSIDA
line: past watching.

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: You are such another!

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: Boy
line: Sir, my lord would instantly speak with you.

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: Where?

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: Boy
line: At your own house; there he unarms him.

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: Good boy, tell him I come.

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: I doubt he be hurt. Fare ye well, good niece.

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: CRESSIDA
line: Adieu, uncle.

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: I'll be with you, niece, by and by.

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: CRESSIDA
line: To bring, uncle?

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: Ay, a token from Troilus.

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: CRESSIDA
line: By the same token, you are a bawd.

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: CRESSIDA
line: Words, vows, gifts, tears, and love's full sacrifice,

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: CRESSIDA
line: He offers in another's enterprise;

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: CRESSIDA
line: But more in Troilus thousand fold I see

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: CRESSIDA
line: Than in the glass of Pandar's praise may be;

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: CRESSIDA
line: Yet hold I off. Women are angels, wooing:

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: CRESSIDA
line: Things won are done; joy's soul lies in the doing.

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: CRESSIDA
line: That she beloved knows nought that knows not this:

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: CRESSIDA
line: Men prize the thing ungain'd more than it is:

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: CRESSIDA
line: That she was never yet that ever knew

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: CRESSIDA
line: Love got so sweet as when desire did sue.

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: CRESSIDA
line: Therefore this maxim out of love I teach:

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: CRESSIDA
line: Achievement is command; ungain'd, beseech:

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: CRESSIDA
line: Then though my heart's content firm love doth bear,

scene: SCENE II.  The Same. A street.
speaker: CRESSIDA
line: Nothing of that shall from mine eyes appear.

scene: SCENE III.  The Grecian camp. Before Agamemnon's tent.
speaker: AGAMEMNON
line: Princes,

scene: SCENE III.  The Grecian camp. Before Agamemnon's tent.
speaker: AGAMEMNON
line: What grief hath set the jaundice on your cheeks?

scene: SCENE III.  The Grecian camp. Before Agamemnon's tent.
speaker: AGAMEMNON
line: The ample proposition that hope makes

scene: SCENE III.  The Grecian camp. Before Agamemnon's tent.
speaker: AGAMEMNON
line: In all designs begun on earth below

scene: SCENE III.  The Grecian camp. Before Agamemnon's tent.
speaker: AGAMEMNON
line: Fails in the promised largeness: cheques and disasters

scene: SCENE III.  The Grecian camp. Before Agamemnon's tent.
speaker: AGAMEMNON
line: Grow in the veins of actions highest rear'd,

scene: SCENE III.  The Grecian camp. Before Agamemnon's tent.
speaker: AGAMEMNON
line: As knots, by the conflux of meeting sap,

scene: SCENE III.  The Grecian camp. Before Agamemnon's tent.
speaker: AGAMEMNON
line: Infect the sound pine and divert his grain

scene: SCENE III.  The Grecian camp. Before Agamemnon's tent.
speaker: AGAMEMNON
line: Tortive and errant from his course of growth.

scene: SCENE III.  The Grecian camp. Before Agamemnon's tent.
speaker: AGAMEMNON
line: Nor, princes, is it matter new to us

scene: SCENE III.  The Grecian camp. Before Agamemnon's tent.
speaker: AGAMEMNON
line: That we come short of our suppose so far

scene: SCENE III.  The Grecian camp. Before Agamemnon's tent.
speaker: AGAMEMNON
line: That after seven years' siege yet Troy walls stand;

scene: SCENE III.  The Grecian camp. Before Agamemnon's tent.
speaker: AGAMEMNON
line: Sith every action that hath gone before,

scene: SCENE III.  The Grecian camp. Before Achilles' tent.
speaker: ULYSSES
line: And say in thunder 'Achilles go to him.'

scene: SCENE III.  The Grecian camp. Before Achilles' tent.
speaker: NESTOR
line: Aside to DIOMEDES  O, this is well; he rubs the

scene: SCENE III.  The Grecian camp. Before Achilles' tent.
speaker: NESTOR
line: vein of him.

scene: SCENE III.  The Grecian camp. Before Achilles' tent.
speaker: DIOMEDES
line: Aside to NESTOR  And how his silence drinks up

scene: SCENE III.  The Grecian camp. Before Achilles' tent.
speaker: DIOMEDES
line: this applause!

scene: SCENE III.  The Grecian camp. Before Achilles' tent.
speaker: AJAX
line: If I go to him, with my armed fist I'll pash him o'er the face.

scene: SCENE III.  The Grecian camp. Before Achilles' tent.
speaker: AGAMEMNON
line: O, no, you shall not go.

scene: SCENE III.  The Grecian camp. Before Achilles' tent.
speaker: AJAX
line: An a' be proud with me, I'll pheeze his pride:

scene: SCENE III.  The Grecian camp. Before Achilles' tent.
speaker: AJAX
line: Let me go to him.

scene: SCENE III.  The Grecian camp. Before Achilles' tent.
speaker: ULYSSES
line: Not for the worth that hangs upon our quarrel.

scene: SCENE III.  The Grecian camp. Before Achilles' tent.
speaker: AJAX
line: A paltry, insolent fellow!

scene: SCENE III.  The Grecian camp. Before Achilles' tent.
speaker: NESTOR
line: How he describes himself!

scene: SCENE III.  The Grecian camp. Before Achilles' tent.
speaker: AJAX
line: Can he not be sociable?

scene: SCENE III.  The Grecian camp. Before Achilles' tent.
speaker: ULYSSES
line: The raven chides blackness.

scene: SCENE III.  The Grecian camp. Before Achilles' tent.
speaker: AJAX
line: I'll let his humours blood.

scene: SCENE III.  The Grecian camp. Before Achilles' tent.
speaker: AGAMEMNON
line: He will be the physician that should be the patient.

scene: SCENE III.  The Grecian camp. Before Achilles' tent.
speaker: AJAX
line: An all men were o' my mind,--

scene: SCENE III.  The Grecian camp. Before Achilles' tent.
speaker: ULYSSES
line: Wit would be out of fashion.

scene: SCENE III.  The Grecian camp. Before Achilles' tent.
speaker: AJAX
line: A' should not bear it so, a' should eat swords first:

scene: SCENE III.  The Grecian camp. Before Achilles' tent.
speaker: AJAX
line: shall pride carry it?

scene: SCENE III.  The Grecian camp. Before Achilles' tent.
speaker: NESTOR
line: An 'twould, you'ld carry half.

scene: SCENE III.  The Grecian camp. Before Achilles' tent.
speaker: ULYSSES
line: A' would have ten shares.

scene: SCENE III.  The Grecian camp. Before Achilles' tent.
speaker: AJAX
line: I will knead him; I'll make him supple.

scene: SCENE III.  The Grecian camp. Before Achilles' tent.
speaker: NESTOR
line: He's not yet through warm: force him with praises:

scene: SCENE III.  The Grecian camp. Before Achilles' tent.
speaker: NESTOR
line: pour in, pour in; his ambition is dry.

scene: SCENE III.  The Grecian camp. Before Achilles' tent.
speaker: ULYSSES
line: To AGAMEMNON  My lord, you feed too much on this dislike.

scene: SCENE III.  The Grecian camp. Before Achilles' tent.
speaker: NESTOR
line: Our noble general, do not do so.

scene: SCENE III.  The Grecian camp. Before Achilles' tent.
speaker: DIOMEDES
line: You must prepare to fight without Achilles.

scene: SCENE III.  The Grecian camp. Before Achilles' tent.
speaker: ULYSSES
line: Why, 'tis this naming of him does him harm.

scene: SCENE III.  The Grecian camp. Before Achilles' tent.
speaker: ULYSSES
line: Here is a man--but 'tis before his face;

scene: SCENE III.  The Grecian camp. Before Achilles' tent.
speaker: ULYSSES
line: I will be silent.

scene: SCENE III.  The Grecian camp. Before Achilles' tent.
speaker: NESTOR
line: Wherefore should you so?

scene: SCENE III.  The Grecian camp. Before Achilles' tent.
speaker: NESTOR
line: He is not emulous, as Achilles is.

scene: SCENE III.  The Grecian camp. Before Achilles' tent.
speaker: ULYSSES
line: Know the whole world, he is as valiant.

scene: SCENE III.  The Grecian camp. Before Achilles' tent.
speaker: AJAX
line: A whoreson dog, that shall pelter thus with us!

scene: SCENE III.  The Grecian camp. Before Achilles' tent.
speaker: AJAX
line: Would he were a Trojan!

scene: SCENE III.  The Grecian camp. Before Achilles' tent.
speaker: NESTOR
line: What a vice were it in Ajax now,--

scene: SCENE III.  The Grecian camp. Before Achilles' tent.
speaker: ULYSSES
line: If he were proud,--

scene: SCENE III.  The Grecian camp. Before Achilles' tent.
speaker: DIOMEDES
line: Or covetous of praise,--

scene: SCENE III.  The Grecian camp. Before Achilles' tent.
speaker: ULYSSES
line: Ay, or surly borne,--

scene: SCENE III.  The Grecian camp. Before Achilles' tent.
speaker: DIOMEDES
line: Or strange, or self-affected!

scene: SCENE III.  The Grecian camp. Before Achilles' tent.
speaker: ULYSSES
line: Thank the heavens, lord, thou art of sweet composure;

scene: SCENE III.  The Grecian camp. Before Achilles' tent.
speaker: ULYSSES
line: Praise him that got thee, she that gave thee suck:

scene: SCENE III.  The Grecian camp. Before Achilles' tent.
speaker: ULYSSES
line: Famed be thy tutor, and thy parts of nature

scene: SCENE III.  The Grecian camp. Before Achilles' tent.
speaker: ULYSSES
line: Thrice famed, beyond all erudition:

scene: SCENE III.  The Grecian camp. Before Achilles' tent.
speaker: ULYSSES
line: But he that disciplined thy arms to fight,

scene: SCENE III.  The Grecian camp. Before Achilles' tent.
speaker: ULYSSES
line: Let Mars divide eternity in twain,

scene: SCENE III.  The Grecian camp. Before Achilles' tent.
speaker: ULYSSES
line: And give him half: and, for thy vigour,

scene: SCENE III.  The Grecian camp. Before Achilles' tent.
speaker: ULYSSES
line: Bull-bearing Milo his addition yield

scene: SCENE III.  The Grecian camp. Before Achilles' tent.
speaker: ULYSSES
line: To sinewy Ajax. I will not praise thy wisdom,

scene: SCENE III.  The Grecian camp. Before Achilles' tent.
speaker: ULYSSES
line: Which, like a bourn, a pale, a shore, confines

scene: SCENE III.  The Grecian camp. Before Achilles' tent.
speaker: ULYSSES
line: Thy spacious and dilated parts: here's Nestor;

scene: SCENE III.  The Grecian camp. Before Achilles' tent.
speaker: ULYSSES
line: Instructed by the antiquary times,

scene: SCENE III.  The Grecian camp. Before Achilles' tent.
speaker: ULYSSES
line: He must, he is, he cannot but be wise:

scene: SCENE III.  The Grecian camp. Before Achilles' tent.
speaker: ULYSSES
line: Put pardon, father Nestor, were your days

scene: SCENE III.  The Grecian camp. Before Achilles' tent.
speaker: ULYSSES
line: As green as Ajax' and your brain so temper'd,

scene: SCENE III.  The Grecian camp. Before Achilles' tent.
speaker: ULYSSES
line: You should not have the eminence of him,

scene: SCENE III.  The Grecian camp. Before Achilles' tent.
speaker: ULYSSES
line: But be as Ajax.

scene: SCENE III.  The Grecian camp. Before Achilles' tent.
speaker: AJAX
line: Shall I call you father?

scene: SCENE III.  The Grecian camp. Before Achilles' tent.
speaker: NESTOR
line: Ay, my good son.

scene: SCENE III.  The Grecian camp. Before Achilles' tent.
speaker: DIOMEDES
line: Be ruled by him, Lord Ajax.

scene: SCENE III.  The Grecian camp. Before Achilles' tent.
speaker: ULYSSES
line: There is no tarrying here; the hart Achilles

scene: SCENE III.  The Grecian camp. Before Achilles' tent.
speaker: ULYSSES
line: Keeps thicket. Please it our great general

scene: SCENE III.  The Grecian camp. Before Achilles' tent.
speaker: ULYSSES
line: To call together all his state of war;

scene: SCENE III.  The Grecian camp. Before Achilles' tent.
speaker: ULYSSES
line: Fresh kings are come to Troy: to-morrow

scene: SCENE III.  The Grecian camp. Before Achilles' tent.
speaker: ULYSSES
line: We must with all our main of power stand fast:

scene: SCENE III.  The Grecian camp. Before Achilles' tent.
speaker: ULYSSES
line: And here's a lord,--come knights from east to west,

scene: SCENE III.  The Grecian camp. Before Achilles' tent.
speaker: ULYSSES
line: And cull their flower, Ajax shall cope the best.

scene: SCENE III.  The Grecian camp. Before Achilles' tent.
speaker: AGAMEMNON
line: Go we to council. Let Achilles sleep:

scene: SCENE III.  The Grecian camp. Before Achilles' tent.
speaker: AGAMEMNON
line: Light boats sail swift, though greater hulks draw deep.

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. Priam's palace.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: Friend, you! pray you, a word: do not you follow

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. Priam's palace.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: the young Lord Paris?

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. Priam's palace.
speaker: Servant
line: Ay, sir, when he goes before me.

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. Priam's palace.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: You depend upon him, I mean?

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. Priam's palace.
speaker: Servant
line: Sir, I do depend upon the lord.

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. Priam's palace.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: You depend upon a noble gentleman; I must needs

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. Priam's palace.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: praise him.

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. Priam's palace.
speaker: Servant
line: The lord be praised!

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. Priam's palace.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: You know me, do you not?

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. Priam's palace.
speaker: Servant
line: Faith, sir, superficially.

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. Priam's palace.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: Friend, know me better; I am the Lord Pandarus.

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. Priam's palace.
speaker: Servant
line: I hope I shall know your honour better.

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. Priam's palace.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: I do desire it.

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. Priam's palace.
speaker: Servant
line: You are in the state of grace.

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. Priam's palace.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: Grace! not so, friend: honour and lordship are my titles.

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. Priam's palace.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: What music is this?

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. Priam's palace.
speaker: Servant
line: I do but partly know, sir: it is music in parts.

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. Priam's palace.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: Know you the musicians?

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. Priam's palace.
speaker: Servant
line: Wholly, sir.

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. Priam's palace.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: Who play they to?

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. Priam's palace.
speaker: Servant
line: To the hearers, sir.

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. Priam's palace.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: At whose pleasure, friend

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. Priam's palace.
speaker: Servant
line: At mine, sir, and theirs that love music.

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. Priam's palace.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: Command, I mean, friend.

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. Priam's palace.
speaker: Servant
line: Who shall I command, sir?

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. Priam's palace.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: Friend, we understand not one another: I am too

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. Priam's palace.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: courtly and thou art too cunning. At whose request

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. Priam's palace.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: do these men play?

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. Priam's palace.
speaker: Servant
line: That's to 't indeed, sir: marry, sir, at the request

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. Priam's palace.
speaker: Servant
line: of Paris my lord, who's there in person; with him,

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. Priam's palace.
speaker: Servant
line: the mortal Venus, the heart-blood of beauty, love's

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. Priam's palace.
speaker: Servant
line: invisible soul,--

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. Priam's palace.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: Who, my cousin Cressida?

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. Priam's palace.
speaker: Servant
line: No, sir, Helen: could you not find out that by her

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. Priam's palace.
speaker: Servant
line: attributes?

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. Priam's palace.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: It should seem, fellow, that thou hast not seen the

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. Priam's palace.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: Lady Cressida. I come to speak with Paris from the

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. Priam's palace.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: Prince Troilus: I will make a complimental assault

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. Priam's palace.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: upon him, for my business seethes.

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. Priam's palace.
speaker: Servant
line: Sodden business! there's a stewed phrase indeed!

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. Priam's palace.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: Fair be to you, my lord, and to all this fair

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. Priam's palace.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: company! fair desires, in all fair measure,

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. Priam's palace.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: fairly guide them! especially to you, fair queen!

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. Priam's palace.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: fair thoughts be your fair pillow!

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. Priam's palace.
speaker: HELEN
line: Dear lord, you are full of fair words.

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. Priam's palace.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: You speak your fair pleasure, sweet queen. Fair

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. Priam's palace.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: prince, here is good broken music.

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. Priam's palace.
speaker: PARIS
line: You have broke it, cousin: and, by my life, you

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. Priam's palace.
speaker: PARIS
line: shall make it whole again; you shall piece it out

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. Priam's palace.
speaker: PARIS
line: with a piece of your performance. Nell, he is full

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. Priam's palace.
speaker: PARIS
line: of harmony.

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. Priam's palace.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: Truly, lady, no.

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. Priam's palace.
speaker: HELEN
line: O, sir,--

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. Priam's palace.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: Rude, in sooth; in good sooth, very rude.

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. Priam's palace.
speaker: PARIS
line: Well said, my lord! well, you say so in fits.

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. Priam's palace.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: I have business to my lord, dear queen. My lord,

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. Priam's palace.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: will you vouchsafe me a word?

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. Priam's palace.
speaker: HELEN
line: Nay, this shall not hedge us out: we'll hear you

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. Priam's palace.
speaker: HELEN
line: sing, certainly.

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. Priam's palace.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: Well, sweet queen. you are pleasant with me. But,

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. Priam's palace.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: marry, thus, my lord: my dear lord and most esteemed

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. Priam's palace.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: friend, your brother Troilus,--

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. Priam's palace.
speaker: HELEN
line: My Lord Pandarus; honey-sweet lord,--

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. Priam's palace.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: Go to, sweet queen, to go:--commends himself most

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. Priam's palace.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: affectionately to you,--

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. Priam's palace.
speaker: HELEN
line: You shall not bob us out of our melody: if you do,

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. Priam's palace.
speaker: HELEN
line: our melancholy upon your head!

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. Priam's palace.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: Sweet queen, sweet queen! that's a sweet queen, i' faith.

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. Priam's palace.
speaker: HELEN
line: And to make a sweet lady sad is a sour offence.

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. Priam's palace.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: Nay, that shall not serve your turn; that shall not,

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. Priam's palace.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: in truth, la. Nay, I care not for such words; no,

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. Priam's palace.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: no. And, my lord, he desires you, that if the king

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. Priam's palace.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: call for him at supper, you will make his excuse.

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. Priam's palace.
speaker: HELEN
line: My Lord Pandarus,--

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. Priam's palace.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: What says my sweet queen, my very very sweet queen?

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. Priam's palace.
speaker: PARIS
line: What exploit's in hand? where sups he to-night?

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. Priam's palace.
speaker: HELEN
line: Nay, but, my lord,--

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. Priam's palace.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: What says my sweet queen? My cousin will fall out

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. Priam's palace.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: with you. You must not know where he sups.

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. Priam's palace.
speaker: PARIS
line: I'll lay my life, with my disposer Cressida.

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. Priam's palace.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: No, no, no such matter; you are wide: come, your

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. Priam's palace.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: disposer is sick.

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. Priam's palace.
speaker: PARIS
line: Well, I'll make excuse.

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. Priam's palace.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: Ay, good my lord. Why should you say Cressida? no,

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. Priam's palace.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: your poor disposer's sick.

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. Priam's palace.
speaker: PARIS
line: I spy.

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. Priam's palace.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: You spy! what do you spy? Come, give me an

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. Priam's palace.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: instrument. Now, sweet queen.

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. Priam's palace.
speaker: HELEN
line: Why, this is kindly done.

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. Priam's palace.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: My niece is horribly in love with a thing you have,

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. Priam's palace.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: sweet queen.

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. Priam's palace.
speaker: HELEN
line: She shall have it, my lord, if it be not my lord Paris.

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. Priam's palace.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: He! no, she'll none of him; they two are twain.

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. Priam's palace.
speaker: HELEN
line: Falling in, after falling out, may make them three.

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. Priam's palace.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: Come, come, I'll hear no more of this; I'll sing

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. Priam's palace.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: you a song now.

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. Priam's palace.
speaker: HELEN
line: Ay, ay, prithee now. By my troth, sweet lord, thou

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. Priam's palace.
speaker: HELEN
line: hast a fine forehead.

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. Priam's palace.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: Ay, you may, you may.

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. Priam's palace.
speaker: HELEN
line: Let thy song be love: this love will undo us all.

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. Priam's palace.
speaker: HELEN
line: O Cupid, Cupid, Cupid!

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. Priam's palace.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: Love! ay, that it shall, i' faith.

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. Priam's palace.
speaker: PARIS
line: Ay, good now, love, love, nothing but love.

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. Priam's palace.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: In good troth, it begins so.

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. Priam's palace.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: Love, love, nothing but love, still more!

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. Priam's palace.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: For, O, love's bow

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. Priam's palace.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: Shoots buck and doe:

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. Priam's palace.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: The shaft confounds,

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. Priam's palace.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: Not that it wounds,

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. Priam's palace.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: But tickles still the sore.

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. Priam's palace.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: These lovers cry Oh! oh! they die!

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. Priam's palace.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: Yet that which seems the wound to kill,

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. Priam's palace.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: Doth turn oh! oh! to ha! ha! he!

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. Priam's palace.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: So dying love lives still:

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. Priam's palace.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: Oh! oh! a while, but ha! ha! ha!

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. Priam's palace.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: Oh! oh! groans out for ha! ha! ha!

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. Priam's palace.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: Heigh-ho!

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. Priam's palace.
speaker: HELEN
line: In love, i' faith, to the very tip of the nose.

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. Priam's palace.
speaker: PARIS
line: He eats nothing but doves, love, and that breeds hot

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. Priam's palace.
speaker: PARIS
line: blood, and hot blood begets hot thoughts, and hot

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. Priam's palace.
speaker: PARIS
line: thoughts beget hot deeds, and hot deeds is love.

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. Priam's palace.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: Is this the generation of love? hot blood, hot

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. Priam's palace.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: thoughts, and hot deeds? Why, they are vipers:

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. Priam's palace.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: is love a generation of vipers? Sweet lord, who's

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. Priam's palace.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: a-field to-day?

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. Priam's palace.
speaker: PARIS
line: Hector, Deiphobus, Helenus, Antenor, and all the

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. Priam's palace.
speaker: PARIS
line: gallantry of Troy: I  would fain have armed to-day,

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. Priam's palace.
speaker: PARIS
line: but my Nell would not have it so. How chance my

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. Priam's palace.
speaker: PARIS
line: brother Troilus went not?

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. Priam's palace.
speaker: HELEN
line: He hangs the lip at something: you know all, Lord Pandarus.
