scene: SCENE I.  Troy. A street.
speaker: DIOMEDES
line: But, in mine emulous honour, let him die,

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. A street.
speaker: DIOMEDES
line: With every joint a wound, and that to-morrow!

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. A street.
speaker: AENEAS
line: We know each other well.

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. A street.
speaker: DIOMEDES
line: We do; and long to know each other worse.

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. A street.
speaker: PARIS
line: This is the most despiteful gentle greeting,

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. A street.
speaker: PARIS
line: The noblest hateful love, that e'er I heard of.

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. A street.
speaker: PARIS
line: What business, lord, so early?

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. A street.
speaker: AENEAS
line: I was sent for to the king; but why, I know not.

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. A street.
speaker: PARIS
line: His purpose meets you: 'twas to bring this Greek

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. A street.
speaker: PARIS
line: To Calchas' house, and there to render him,

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. A street.
speaker: PARIS
line: For the enfreed Antenor, the fair Cressid:

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. A street.
speaker: PARIS
line: Let's have your company, or, if you please,

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. A street.
speaker: PARIS
line: Haste there before us: I constantly do think--

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. A street.
speaker: PARIS
line: Or rather, call my thought a certain knowledge--

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. A street.
speaker: PARIS
line: My brother Troilus lodges there to-night:

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. A street.
speaker: PARIS
line: Rouse him and give him note of our approach.

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. A street.
speaker: PARIS
line: With the whole quality wherefore: I fear

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. A street.
speaker: PARIS
line: We shall be much unwelcome.

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. A street.
speaker: AENEAS
line: That I assure you:

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. A street.
speaker: AENEAS
line: Troilus had rather Troy were borne to Greece

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. A street.
speaker: AENEAS
line: Than Cressid borne from Troy.

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. A street.
speaker: PARIS
line: There is no help;

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. A street.
speaker: PARIS
line: The bitter disposition of the time

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. A street.
speaker: PARIS
line: Will have it so. On, lord; we'll follow you.

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. A street.
speaker: AENEAS
line: Good morrow, all.

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. A street.
speaker: PARIS
line: And tell me, noble Diomed, faith, tell me true,

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. A street.
speaker: PARIS
line: Even in the soul of sound good-fellowship,

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. A street.
speaker: PARIS
line: Who, in your thoughts, merits fair Helen best,

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. A street.
speaker: PARIS
line: Myself or Menelaus?

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. A street.
speaker: DIOMEDES
line: Both alike:

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. A street.
speaker: DIOMEDES
line: He merits well to have her, that doth seek her,

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. A street.
speaker: DIOMEDES
line: Not making any scruple of her soilure,

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. A street.
speaker: DIOMEDES
line: With such a hell of pain and world of charge,

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. A street.
speaker: DIOMEDES
line: And you as well to keep her, that defend her,

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. A street.
speaker: DIOMEDES
line: Not palating the taste of her dishonour,

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. A street.
speaker: DIOMEDES
line: With such a costly loss of wealth and friends:

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. A street.
speaker: DIOMEDES
line: He, like a puling cuckold, would drink up

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. A street.
speaker: DIOMEDES
line: The lees and dregs of a flat tamed piece;

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. A street.
speaker: DIOMEDES
line: You, like a lecher, out of whorish loins

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. A street.
speaker: DIOMEDES
line: Are pleased to breed out your inheritors:

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. A street.
speaker: DIOMEDES
line: Both merits poised, each weighs nor less nor more;

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. A street.
speaker: DIOMEDES
line: But he as he, the heavier for a whore.

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. A street.
speaker: PARIS
line: You are too bitter to your countrywoman.

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. A street.
speaker: DIOMEDES
line: She's bitter to her country: hear me, Paris:

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. A street.
speaker: DIOMEDES
line: For every false drop in her bawdy veins

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. A street.
speaker: DIOMEDES
line: A Grecian's life hath sunk; for every scruple

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. A street.
speaker: DIOMEDES
line: Of her contaminated carrion weight,

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. A street.
speaker: DIOMEDES
line: A Trojan hath been slain: since she could speak,

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. A street.
speaker: DIOMEDES
line: She hath not given so many good words breath

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. A street.
speaker: DIOMEDES
line: As for her Greeks and Trojans suffer'd death.

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. A street.
speaker: PARIS
line: Fair Diomed, you do as chapmen do,

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. A street.
speaker: PARIS
line: Dispraise the thing that you desire to buy:

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. A street.
speaker: PARIS
line: But we in silence hold this virtue well,

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. A street.
speaker: PARIS
line: We'll but commend what we intend to sell.

scene: SCENE I.  Troy. A street.
speaker: PARIS
line: Here lies our way.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Court of Pandarus' house.
speaker: TROILUS
line: Dear, trouble not yourself: the morn is cold.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Court of Pandarus' house.
speaker: CRESSIDA
line: Then, sweet my lord, I'll call mine uncle down;

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Court of Pandarus' house.
speaker: CRESSIDA
line: He shall unbolt the gates.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Court of Pandarus' house.
speaker: TROILUS
line: Trouble him not;

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Court of Pandarus' house.
speaker: TROILUS
line: To bed, to bed: sleep kill those pretty eyes,

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Court of Pandarus' house.
speaker: TROILUS
line: And give as soft attachment to thy senses

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Court of Pandarus' house.
speaker: TROILUS
line: As infants' empty of all thought!

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Court of Pandarus' house.
speaker: CRESSIDA
line: Good morrow, then.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Court of Pandarus' house.
speaker: TROILUS
line: I prithee now, to bed.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Court of Pandarus' house.
speaker: CRESSIDA
line: Are you a-weary of me?

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Court of Pandarus' house.
speaker: TROILUS
line: O Cressida! but that the busy day,

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Court of Pandarus' house.
speaker: TROILUS
line: Waked by the lark, hath roused the ribald crows,

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Court of Pandarus' house.
speaker: TROILUS
line: And dreaming night will hide our joys no longer,

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Court of Pandarus' house.
speaker: TROILUS
line: I would not from thee.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Court of Pandarus' house.
speaker: CRESSIDA
line: Night hath been too brief.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Court of Pandarus' house.
speaker: TROILUS
line: Beshrew the witch! with venomous wights she stays

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Court of Pandarus' house.
speaker: TROILUS
line: As tediously as hell, but flies the grasps of love

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Court of Pandarus' house.
speaker: TROILUS
line: With wings more momentary-swift than thought.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Court of Pandarus' house.
speaker: TROILUS
line: You will catch cold, and curse me.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Court of Pandarus' house.
speaker: CRESSIDA
line: Prithee, tarry:

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Court of Pandarus' house.
speaker: CRESSIDA
line: You men will never tarry.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Court of Pandarus' house.
speaker: CRESSIDA
line: O foolish Cressid! I might have still held off,

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Court of Pandarus' house.
speaker: CRESSIDA
line: And then you would have tarried. Hark!

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Court of Pandarus' house.
speaker: CRESSIDA
line: there's one up.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Court of Pandarus' house.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: Within  What, 's all the doors open here?

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Court of Pandarus' house.
speaker: TROILUS
line: It is your uncle.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Court of Pandarus' house.
speaker: CRESSIDA
line: A pestilence on him! now will he be mocking:

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Court of Pandarus' house.
speaker: CRESSIDA
line: I shall have such a life!

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Court of Pandarus' house.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: How now, how now! how go maidenheads? Here, you

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Court of Pandarus' house.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: maid! where's my cousin Cressid?

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Court of Pandarus' house.
speaker: CRESSIDA
line: Go hang yourself, you naughty mocking uncle!

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Court of Pandarus' house.
speaker: CRESSIDA
line: You bring me to do, and then you flout me too.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Court of Pandarus' house.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: To do what? to do what? let her say

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Court of Pandarus' house.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: what: what have I brought you to do?

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Court of Pandarus' house.
speaker: CRESSIDA
line: Come, come, beshrew your heart! you'll ne'er be good,

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Court of Pandarus' house.
speaker: CRESSIDA
line: Nor suffer others.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Court of Pandarus' house.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: Ha! ha! Alas, poor wretch! ah, poor capocchia!

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Court of Pandarus' house.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: hast not slept to-night? would he not, a naughty

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Court of Pandarus' house.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: man, let it sleep? a bugbear take him!

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Court of Pandarus' house.
speaker: CRESSIDA
line: Did not I tell you? Would he were knock'd i' the head!

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Court of Pandarus' house.
speaker: CRESSIDA
line: Who's that at door? good uncle, go and see.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Court of Pandarus' house.
speaker: CRESSIDA
line: My lord, come you again into my chamber:

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Court of Pandarus' house.
speaker: CRESSIDA
line: You smile and mock me, as if I meant naughtily.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Court of Pandarus' house.
speaker: TROILUS
line: Ha, ha!

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Court of Pandarus' house.
speaker: CRESSIDA
line: Come, you are deceived, I think of no such thing.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Court of Pandarus' house.
speaker: CRESSIDA
line: How earnestly they knock! Pray you, come in:

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Court of Pandarus' house.
speaker: CRESSIDA
line: I would not for half Troy have you seen here.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Court of Pandarus' house.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: Who's there? what's the matter? will you beat

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Court of Pandarus' house.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: down the door? How now! what's the matter?

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Court of Pandarus' house.
speaker: AENEAS
line: Good morrow, lord, good morrow.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Court of Pandarus' house.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: Who's there? my Lord AEneas! By my troth,

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Court of Pandarus' house.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: I knew you not: what news with you so early?

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Court of Pandarus' house.
speaker: AENEAS
line: Is not Prince Troilus here?

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Court of Pandarus' house.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: Here! what should he do here?

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Court of Pandarus' house.
speaker: AENEAS
line: Come, he is here, my lord; do not deny him:

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Court of Pandarus' house.
speaker: AENEAS
line: It doth import him much to speak with me.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Court of Pandarus' house.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: Is he here, say you? 'tis more than I know, I'll

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Court of Pandarus' house.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: be sworn: for my own part, I came in late. What

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Court of Pandarus' house.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: should he do here?

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Court of Pandarus' house.
speaker: AENEAS
line: Who!--nay, then: come, come, you'll do him wrong

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Court of Pandarus' house.
speaker: AENEAS
line: ere you're ware: you'll be so true to him, to be

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Court of Pandarus' house.
speaker: AENEAS
line: false to him: do not you know of him, but yet go

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Court of Pandarus' house.
speaker: AENEAS
line: fetch him hither; go.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Court of Pandarus' house.
speaker: TROILUS
line: How now! what's the matter?

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Court of Pandarus' house.
speaker: AENEAS
line: My lord, I scarce have leisure to salute you,

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Court of Pandarus' house.
speaker: AENEAS
line: My matter is so rash: there is at hand

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Court of Pandarus' house.
speaker: AENEAS
line: Paris your brother, and Deiphobus,

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Court of Pandarus' house.
speaker: AENEAS
line: The Grecian Diomed, and our Antenor

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Court of Pandarus' house.
speaker: AENEAS
line: Deliver'd to us; and for him forthwith,

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Court of Pandarus' house.
speaker: AENEAS
line: Ere the first sacrifice, within this hour,

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Court of Pandarus' house.
speaker: AENEAS
line: We must give up to Diomedes' hand

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Court of Pandarus' house.
speaker: AENEAS
line: The Lady Cressida.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Court of Pandarus' house.
speaker: TROILUS
line: Is it so concluded?

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Court of Pandarus' house.
speaker: AENEAS
line: By Priam and the general state of Troy:

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Court of Pandarus' house.
speaker: AENEAS
line: They are at hand and ready to effect it.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Court of Pandarus' house.
speaker: TROILUS
line: How my achievements mock me!

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Court of Pandarus' house.
speaker: TROILUS
line: I will go meet them: and, my Lord AEneas,

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Court of Pandarus' house.
speaker: TROILUS
line: We met by chance; you did not find me here.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Court of Pandarus' house.
speaker: AENEAS
line: Good, good, my lord; the secrets of nature

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Court of Pandarus' house.
speaker: AENEAS
line: Have not more gift in taciturnity.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Court of Pandarus' house.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: Is't possible? no sooner got but lost? The devil

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Court of Pandarus' house.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: take Antenor! the young prince will go mad: a

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Court of Pandarus' house.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: plague upon Antenor! I would they had broke 's neck!

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Court of Pandarus' house.
speaker: CRESSIDA
line: How now! what's the matter? who was here?

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Court of Pandarus' house.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: Ah, ah!

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Court of Pandarus' house.
speaker: CRESSIDA
line: Why sigh you so profoundly? where's my lord? gone!

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Court of Pandarus' house.
speaker: CRESSIDA
line: Tell me, sweet uncle, what's the matter?

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Court of Pandarus' house.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: Would I were as deep under the earth as I am above!

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Court of Pandarus' house.
speaker: CRESSIDA
line: O the gods! what's the matter?

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Court of Pandarus' house.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: Prithee, get thee in: would thou hadst ne'er been

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Court of Pandarus' house.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: born! I knew thou wouldst be his death. O, poor

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Court of Pandarus' house.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: gentleman! A plague upon Antenor!

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Court of Pandarus' house.
speaker: CRESSIDA
line: Good uncle, I beseech you, on my knees! beseech you,

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Court of Pandarus' house.
speaker: CRESSIDA
line: what's the matter?

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Court of Pandarus' house.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: Thou must be gone, wench, thou must be gone; thou

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Court of Pandarus' house.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: art changed for Antenor: thou must to thy father,

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Court of Pandarus' house.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: and be gone from Troilus: 'twill be his death;

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Court of Pandarus' house.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: 'twill be his bane; he cannot bear it.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Court of Pandarus' house.
speaker: CRESSIDA
line: O you immortal gods! I will not go.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Court of Pandarus' house.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: Thou must.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Court of Pandarus' house.
speaker: CRESSIDA
line: I will not, uncle: I have forgot my father;

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Court of Pandarus' house.
speaker: CRESSIDA
line: I know no touch of consanguinity;

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Court of Pandarus' house.
speaker: CRESSIDA
line: No kin no love, no blood, no soul so near me

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Court of Pandarus' house.
speaker: CRESSIDA
line: As the sweet Troilus. O you gods divine!

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Court of Pandarus' house.
speaker: CRESSIDA
line: Make Cressid's name the very crown of falsehood,

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Court of Pandarus' house.
speaker: CRESSIDA
line: If ever she leave Troilus! Time, force, and death,

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Court of Pandarus' house.
speaker: CRESSIDA
line: Do to this body what extremes you can;

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Court of Pandarus' house.
speaker: CRESSIDA
line: But the strong base and building of my love

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Court of Pandarus' house.
speaker: CRESSIDA
line: Is as the very centre of the earth,

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Court of Pandarus' house.
speaker: CRESSIDA
line: Drawing all things to it. I'll go in and weep,--

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Court of Pandarus' house.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: Do, do.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Court of Pandarus' house.
speaker: CRESSIDA
line: Tear my bright hair and scratch my praised cheeks,

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Court of Pandarus' house.
speaker: CRESSIDA
line: Crack my clear voice with sobs and break my heart

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Court of Pandarus' house.
speaker: CRESSIDA
line: With sounding Troilus. I will not go from Troy.

scene: SCENE III.  The same. Street before Pandarus' house.
speaker: PARIS
line: It is great morning, and the hour prefix'd

scene: SCENE III.  The same. Street before Pandarus' house.
speaker: PARIS
line: Of her delivery to this valiant Greek

scene: SCENE III.  The same. Street before Pandarus' house.
speaker: PARIS
line: Comes fast upon. Good my brother Troilus,

scene: SCENE III.  The same. Street before Pandarus' house.
speaker: PARIS
line: Tell you the lady what she is to do,

scene: SCENE III.  The same. Street before Pandarus' house.
speaker: PARIS
line: And haste her to the purpose.

scene: SCENE III.  The same. Street before Pandarus' house.
speaker: TROILUS
line: Walk into her house;

scene: SCENE III.  The same. Street before Pandarus' house.
speaker: TROILUS
line: I'll bring her to the Grecian presently:

scene: SCENE III.  The same. Street before Pandarus' house.
speaker: TROILUS
line: And to his hand when I deliver her,

scene: SCENE III.  The same. Street before Pandarus' house.
speaker: TROILUS
line: Think it an altar, and thy brother Troilus

scene: SCENE III.  The same. Street before Pandarus' house.
speaker: TROILUS
line: A priest there offering to it his own heart.

scene: SCENE III.  The same. Street before Pandarus' house.
speaker: PARIS
line: I know what 'tis to love;

scene: SCENE III.  The same. Street before Pandarus' house.
speaker: PARIS
line: And would, as I shall pity, I could help!

scene: SCENE III.  The same. Street before Pandarus' house.
speaker: PARIS
line: Please you walk in, my lords.

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. Pandarus' house.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: Be moderate, be moderate.

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. Pandarus' house.
speaker: CRESSIDA
line: Why tell you me of moderation?

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. Pandarus' house.
speaker: CRESSIDA
line: The grief is fine, full, perfect, that I taste,

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. Pandarus' house.
speaker: CRESSIDA
line: And violenteth in a sense as strong

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. Pandarus' house.
speaker: CRESSIDA
line: As that which causeth it: how can I moderate it?

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. Pandarus' house.
speaker: CRESSIDA
line: If I could temporize with my affection,

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. Pandarus' house.
speaker: CRESSIDA
line: Or brew it to a weak and colder palate,

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. Pandarus' house.
speaker: CRESSIDA
line: The like allayment could I give my grief.

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. Pandarus' house.
speaker: CRESSIDA
line: My love admits no qualifying dross;

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. Pandarus' house.
speaker: CRESSIDA
line: No more my grief, in such a precious loss.

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. Pandarus' house.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: Here, here, here he comes.

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. Pandarus' house.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: Ah, sweet ducks!

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. Pandarus' house.
speaker: CRESSIDA
line: O Troilus! Troilus!

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. Pandarus' house.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: What a pair of spectacles is here!

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. Pandarus' house.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: Let me embrace too. 'O heart,' as the goodly saying is,

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. Pandarus' house.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: '--O heart, heavy heart,

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. Pandarus' house.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: Why sigh'st thou without breaking?

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. Pandarus' house.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: where he answers again,

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. Pandarus' house.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: 'Because thou canst not ease thy smart

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. Pandarus' house.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: By friendship nor by speaking.'

scene: SCENE IV.  The same. Pandarus' house.
speaker: PANDARUS

scene: SCENE V.  The Grecian camp. Lists set out.
speaker: ULYSSES
line: Fie, fie upon her!

scene: SCENE V.  The Grecian camp. Lists set out.
speaker: ULYSSES
line: There's language in her eye, her cheek, her lip,

scene: SCENE V.  The Grecian camp. Lists set out.
speaker: ULYSSES
line: Nay, her foot speaks; her wanton spirits look out

scene: SCENE V.  The Grecian camp. Lists set out.
speaker: ULYSSES
line: At every joint and motive of her body.

scene: SCENE V.  The Grecian camp. Lists set out.
speaker: ULYSSES
line: O, these encounterers, so glib of tongue,

scene: SCENE V.  The Grecian camp. Lists set out.
speaker: ULYSSES
line: That give accosting welcome ere it comes,

scene: SCENE V.  The Grecian camp. Lists set out.
speaker: ULYSSES
line: And wide unclasp the tables of their thoughts

scene: SCENE V.  The Grecian camp. Lists set out.
speaker: ULYSSES
line: To every ticklish reader! set them down

scene: SCENE V.  The Grecian camp. Lists set out.
speaker: ULYSSES
line: For sluttish spoils of opportunity

scene: SCENE V.  The Grecian camp. Lists set out.
speaker: ULYSSES
line: And daughters of the game.

scene: SCENE V.  The Grecian camp. Lists set out.
speaker: ALL
line: The Trojans' trumpet.

scene: SCENE V.  The Grecian camp. Lists set out.
speaker: AGAMEMNON
line: Yonder comes the troop.

scene: SCENE V.  The Grecian camp. Lists set out.
speaker: AENEAS
line: Hail, all you state of Greece! what shall be done

scene: SCENE V.  The Grecian camp. Lists set out.
speaker: AENEAS
line: To him that victory commands? or do you purpose

scene: SCENE V.  The Grecian camp. Lists set out.
speaker: AENEAS
line: A victor shall be known? will you the knights

scene: SCENE V.  The Grecian camp. Lists set out.
speaker: AENEAS
line: Shall to the edge of all extremity

scene: SCENE V.  The Grecian camp. Lists set out.
speaker: AENEAS
line: Pursue each other, or shall be divided

scene: SCENE V.  The Grecian camp. Lists set out.
speaker: AENEAS
line: By any voice or order of the field?

scene: SCENE V.  The Grecian camp. Lists set out.
speaker: AENEAS
line: Hector bade ask.

scene: SCENE V.  The Grecian camp. Lists set out.
speaker: AGAMEMNON
line: Which way would Hector have it?

scene: SCENE V.  The Grecian camp. Lists set out.
speaker: AENEAS
line: He cares not; he'll obey conditions.

scene: SCENE V.  The Grecian camp. Lists set out.
speaker: ACHILLES
line: 'Tis done like Hector; but securely done,

scene: SCENE V.  The Grecian camp. Lists set out.
speaker: ACHILLES
line: A little proudly, and great deal misprizing

scene: SCENE V.  The Grecian camp. Lists set out.
speaker: ACHILLES
line: The knight opposed.

scene: SCENE V.  The Grecian camp. Lists set out.
speaker: AENEAS
line: If not Achilles, sir,

scene: SCENE V.  The Grecian camp. Lists set out.
speaker: AENEAS
line: What is your name?

scene: SCENE V.  The Grecian camp. Lists set out.
speaker: ACHILLES
line: If not Achilles, nothing.

scene: SCENE V.  The Grecian camp. Lists set out.
speaker: AENEAS
line: Therefore Achilles: but, whate'er, know this:

scene: SCENE V.  The Grecian camp. Lists set out.
speaker: AENEAS
line: In the extremity of great and little,

scene: SCENE V.  The Grecian camp. Lists set out.
speaker: AENEAS
line: Valour and pride excel themselves in Hector;

scene: SCENE V.  The Grecian camp. Lists set out.
speaker: AENEAS
line: The one almost as infinite as all,

scene: SCENE V.  The Grecian camp. Lists set out.
speaker: AENEAS
line: The other blank as nothing. Weigh him well,

scene: SCENE V.  The Grecian camp. Lists set out.
speaker: AENEAS
line: And that which looks like pride is courtesy.

scene: SCENE V.  The Grecian camp. Lists set out.
speaker: AENEAS
line: This Ajax is half made of Hector's blood:

scene: SCENE V.  The Grecian camp. Lists set out.
speaker: AENEAS
line: In love whereof, half Hector stays at home;

scene: SCENE V.  The Grecian camp. Lists set out.
speaker: AENEAS
line: Half heart, half hand, half Hector comes to seek

scene: SCENE V.  The Grecian camp. Lists set out.
speaker: AENEAS
line: This blended knight, half Trojan and half Greek.

scene: SCENE V.  The Grecian camp. Lists set out.
speaker: ACHILLES
line: A maiden battle, then? O, I perceive you.

scene: SCENE V.  The Grecian camp. Lists set out.
speaker: AGAMEMNON
line: Here is Sir Diomed. Go, gentle knight,

scene: SCENE V.  The Grecian camp. Lists set out.
speaker: AGAMEMNON
line: Stand by our Ajax: as you and Lord AEneas

scene: SCENE V.  The Grecian camp. Lists set out.
speaker: AGAMEMNON
line: Consent upon the order of their fight,

scene: SCENE V.  The Grecian camp. Lists set out.
speaker: AGAMEMNON
line: So be it; either to the uttermost,

scene: SCENE V.  The Grecian camp. Lists set out.
speaker: AGAMEMNON
line: Or else a breath: the combatants being kin

scene: SCENE V.  The Grecian camp. Lists set out.
speaker: AGAMEMNON
line: Half stints their strife before their strokes begin.

scene: SCENE V.  The Grecian camp. Lists set out.
speaker: ULYSSES
line: They are opposed already.

scene: SCENE V.  The Grecian camp. Lists set out.
speaker: AGAMEMNON
line: What Trojan is that same that looks so heavy?

scene: SCENE V.  The Grecian camp. Lists set out.
speaker: ULYSSES
line: The youngest son of Priam, a true knight,

scene: SCENE V.  The Grecian camp. Lists set out.
speaker: ULYSSES
line: Not yet mature, yet matchless, firm of word,

scene: SCENE V.  The Grecian camp. Lists set out.
speaker: ULYSSES
line: Speaking in deeds and deedless in his tongue;

scene: SCENE V.  The Grecian camp. Lists set out.
speaker: ULYSSES
line: Not soon provoked nor being provoked soon calm'd:

scene: SCENE V.  The Grecian camp. Lists set out.
speaker: ULYSSES
line: His heart and hand both open and both free;

scene: SCENE V.  The Grecian camp. Lists set out.
speaker: ULYSSES
line: For what he has he gives, what thinks he shows;

scene: SCENE V.  The Grecian camp. Lists set out.
speaker: ULYSSES
line: Yet gives he not till judgment guide his bounty,

scene: SCENE V.  The Grecian camp. Lists set out.
speaker: ULYSSES
line: Nor dignifies an impure thought with breath;

scene: SCENE V.  The Grecian camp. Lists set out.
speaker: ULYSSES
line: Manly as Hector, but more dangerous;

scene: SCENE V.  The Grecian camp. Lists set out.
speaker: ULYSSES
line: For Hector in his blaze of wrath subscribes

scene: SCENE V.  The Grecian camp. Lists set out.
speaker: ULYSSES
line: To tender objects, but he in heat of action

scene: SCENE V.  The Grecian camp. Lists set out.
speaker: ULYSSES
line: Is more vindicative than jealous love:

scene: SCENE V.  The Grecian camp. Lists set out.
speaker: ULYSSES
line: They call him Troilus, and on him erect

scene: SCENE V.  The Grecian camp. Lists set out.
speaker: ULYSSES
line: A second hope, as fairly built as Hector.

scene: SCENE V.  The Grecian camp. Lists set out.
speaker: ULYSSES
line: Thus says AEneas; one that knows the youth

scene: SCENE V.  The Grecian camp. Lists set out.
speaker: ULYSSES
line: Even to his inches, and with private soul

scene: SCENE V.  The Grecian camp. Lists set out.
speaker: ULYSSES
line: Did in great Ilion thus translate him to me.

scene: SCENE V.  The Grecian camp. Lists set out.
speaker: AGAMEMNON
line: They are in action.

scene: SCENE V.  The Grecian camp. Lists set out.
speaker: NESTOR
line: Now, Ajax, hold thine own!

scene: SCENE V.  The Grecian camp. Lists set out.
speaker: TROILUS
line: Hector, thou sleep'st;

scene: SCENE V.  The Grecian camp. Lists set out.
speaker: TROILUS
line: Awake thee!

scene: SCENE V.  The Grecian camp. Lists set out.
speaker: AGAMEMNON
line: His blows are well disposed: there, Ajax!

scene: SCENE V.  The Grecian camp. Lists set out.
speaker: DIOMEDES
line: You must no more.

scene: SCENE V.  The Grecian camp. Lists set out.
speaker: AENEAS
line: Princes, enough, so please you.

scene: SCENE V.  The Grecian camp. Lists set out.
speaker: AJAX
line: I am not warm yet; let us fight again.

scene: SCENE V.  The Grecian camp. Lists set out.
speaker: DIOMEDES
line: As Hector pleases.

scene: SCENE V.  The Grecian camp. Lists set out.
speaker: HECTOR
line: Why, then will I no more:

scene: SCENE V.  The Grecian camp. Lists set out.
speaker: HECTOR
line: Thou art, great lord, my father's sister's son,

scene: SCENE V.  The Grecian camp. Lists set out.
speaker: HECTOR
line: A cousin-german to great Priam's seed;

scene: SCENE V.  The Grecian camp. Lists set out.
speaker: HECTOR
line: The obligation of our blood forbids

scene: SCENE V.  The Grecian camp. Lists set out.
speaker: HECTOR
line: A gory emulation 'twixt us twain:

scene: SCENE V.  The Grecian camp. Lists set out.
speaker: HECTOR
line: Were thy commixtion Greek and Trojan so

scene: SCENE V.  The Grecian camp. Lists set out.
speaker: HECTOR
line: That thou couldst say 'This hand is Grecian all,

scene: SCENE V.  The Grecian camp. Lists set out.
speaker: HECTOR
line: And this is Trojan; the sinews of this leg

scene: SCENE V.  The Grecian camp. Lists set out.
speaker: HECTOR
line: All Greek, and this all Troy; my mother's blood

scene: SCENE V.  The Grecian camp. Lists set out.
speaker: HECTOR
line: Runs on the dexter cheek, and this sinister

scene: SCENE V.  The Grecian camp. Lists set out.
speaker: HECTOR
line: Bounds in my father's;' by Jove multipotent,

scene: SCENE V.  The Grecian camp. Lists set out.
speaker: HECTOR
line: Thou shouldst not bear from me a Greekish member

scene: SCENE V.  The Grecian camp. Lists set out.
speaker: HECTOR
line: Wherein my sword had not impressure made

scene: SCENE V.  The Grecian camp. Lists set out.
speaker: HECTOR
line: Of our rank feud: but the just gods gainsay

scene: SCENE V.  The Grecian camp. Lists set out.
speaker: HECTOR
line: That any drop thou borrow'dst from thy mother,

scene: SCENE V.  The Grecian camp. Lists set out.
speaker: HECTOR
line: My sacred aunt, should by my mortal sword

scene: SCENE V.  The Grecian camp. Lists set out.
speaker: HECTOR
line: Be drain'd! Let me embrace thee, Ajax:

scene: SCENE V.  The Grecian camp. Lists set out.
speaker: HECTOR
line: By him that thunders, thou hast lusty arms;

scene: SCENE V.  The Grecian camp. Lists set out.
speaker: HECTOR
line: Hector would have them fall upon him thus:

scene: SCENE V.  The Grecian camp. Lists set out.
speaker: HECTOR
line: Cousin, all honour to thee!

scene: SCENE V.  The Grecian camp. Lists set out.
speaker: AJAX
line: I thank thee, Hector

scene: SCENE V.  The Grecian camp. Lists set out.
speaker: AJAX
line: Thou art too gentle and too free a man:

scene: SCENE V.  The Grecian camp. Lists set out.
speaker: AJAX
line: I came to kill thee, cousin, and bear hence

scene: SCENE V.  The Grecian camp. Lists set out.
speaker: AJAX
line: A great addition earned in thy death.

scene: SCENE V.  The Grecian camp. Lists set out.
speaker: HECTOR
line: Not Neoptolemus so mirable,

scene: SCENE V.  The Grecian camp. Lists set out.
speaker: HECTOR
line: On whose bright crest Fame with her loud'st Oyes

scene: SCENE V.  The Grecian camp. Lists set out.
speaker: HECTOR
line: Cries 'This is he,' could promise to himself

scene: SCENE V.  The Grecian camp. Lists set out.
speaker: HECTOR
line: A thought of added honour torn from Hector.

scene: SCENE V.  The Grecian camp. Lists set out.
speaker: AENEAS
line: There is expectance here from both the sides,

scene: SCENE V.  The Grecian camp. Lists set out.
speaker: AENEAS
line: What further you will do.

scene: SCENE V.  The Grecian camp. Lists set out.
speaker: HECTOR
line: We'll answer it;

scene: SCENE V.  The Grecian camp. Lists set out.
speaker: HECTOR
line: The issue is embracement: Ajax, farewell.

scene: SCENE V.  The Grecian camp. Lists set out.
speaker: AJAX
line: If I might in entreaties find success--

scene: SCENE V.  The Grecian camp. Lists set out.
speaker: AJAX
line: As seld I have the chance--I would desire

scene: SCENE V.  The Grecian camp. Lists set out.
speaker: AJAX
line: My famous cousin to our Grecian tents.

scene: SCENE V.  The Grecian camp. Lists set out.
speaker: DIOMEDES
line: 'Tis Agamemnon's wish, and great Achilles

scene: SCENE V.  The Grecian camp. Lists set out.
speaker: DIOMEDES
line: Doth long to see unarm'd the valiant Hector.

scene: SCENE V.  The Grecian camp. Lists set out.
speaker: HECTOR
line: AEneas, call my brother Troilus to me,

scene: SCENE V.  The Grecian camp. Lists set out.
speaker: HECTOR
line: And signify this loving interview

scene: SCENE V.  The Grecian camp. Lists set out.
speaker: HECTOR
line: To the expecters of our Trojan part;

scene: SCENE V.  The Grecian camp. Lists set out.
speaker: HECTOR
line: Desire them home. Give me thy hand, my cousin;

scene: SCENE V.  The Grecian camp. Lists set out.
speaker: HECTOR
line: I will go eat with thee and see your knights.

scene: SCENE V.  The Grecian camp. Lists set out.
speaker: AJAX
line: Great Agamemnon comes to meet us here.

scene: SCENE V.  The Grecian camp. Lists set out.
speaker: HECTOR
line: The worthiest of them tell me name by name;

scene: SCENE V.  The Grecian camp. Lists set out.
speaker: HECTOR
line: But for Achilles, mine own searching eyes

scene: SCENE V.  The Grecian camp. Lists set out.
speaker: HECTOR
line: Shall find him by his large and portly size.

scene: SCENE V.  The Grecian camp. Lists set out.
speaker: AGAMEMNON
line: Worthy of arms! as welcome as to one

scene: SCENE V.  The Grecian camp. Lists set out.
speaker: AGAMEMNON
line: That would be rid of such an enemy;

scene: SCENE V.  The Grecian camp. Lists set out.
speaker: AGAMEMNON
line: But that's no welcome: understand more clear,

scene: SCENE V.  The Grecian camp. Lists set out.
speaker: AGAMEMNON
line: What's past and what's to come is strew'd with husks

scene: SCENE V.  The Grecian camp. Lists set out.
speaker: AGAMEMNON
line: And formless ruin of oblivion;

scene: SCENE V.  The Grecian camp. Lists set out.
speaker: AGAMEMNON
line: But in this extant moment, faith and troth,

scene: SCENE V.  The Grecian camp. Lists set out.
speaker: AGAMEMNON
line: Strain'd purely from all hollow bias-drawing,

scene: SCENE V.  The Grecian camp. Lists set out.
speaker: AGAMEMNON
line: Bids thee, with most divine integrity,

scene: SCENE V.  The Grecian camp. Lists set out.
speaker: AGAMEMNON
line: From heart of very heart, great Hector, welcome.

scene: SCENE V.  The Grecian camp. Lists set out.
speaker: HECTOR
line: I thank thee, most imperious Agamemnon.

scene: SCENE V.  The Grecian camp. Lists set out.
speaker: AGAMEMNON
line: To TROILUS  My well-famed lord of Troy, no

scene: SCENE V.  The Grecian camp. Lists set out.
speaker: AGAMEMNON
line: less to you.

scene: SCENE V.  The Grecian camp. Lists set out.
speaker: MENELAUS
line: Let me confirm my princely brother's greeting:

scene: SCENE V.  The Grecian camp. Lists set out.
speaker: MENELAUS
line: You brace of warlike brothers, welcome hither.

scene: SCENE V.  The Grecian camp. Lists set out.
speaker: HECTOR
line: Who must we answer?

scene: SCENE V.  The Grecian camp. Lists set out.
speaker: AENEAS
line: The noble Menelaus.

scene: SCENE V.  The Grecian camp. Lists set out.
speaker: HECTOR
line: O, you, my lord? by Mars his gauntlet, thanks!

scene: SCENE V.  The Grecian camp. Lists set out.
speaker: HECTOR
line: Mock not, that I affect the untraded oath;

scene: SCENE V.  The Grecian camp. Lists set out.
speaker: HECTOR
line: Your quondam wife swears still by Venus' glove:

scene: SCENE V.  The Grecian camp. Lists set out.
speaker: HECTOR
line: She's well, but bade me not commend her to you.

scene: SCENE V.  The Grecian camp. Lists set out.
speaker: MENELAUS
line: Name her not now, sir; she's a deadly theme.

scene: SCENE V.  The Grecian camp. Lists set out.
speaker: HECTOR
line: O, pardon; I offend.

scene: SCENE V.  The Grecian camp. Lists set out.
speaker: NESTOR
line: I have, thou gallant Trojan, seen thee oft

scene: SCENE V.  The Grecian camp. Lists set out.
speaker: NESTOR
line: Labouring for destiny make cruel way

scene: SCENE V.  The Grecian camp. Lists set out.
speaker: NESTOR
line: Through ranks of Greekish youth, and I have seen thee,

scene: SCENE V.  The Grecian camp. Lists set out.
speaker: NESTOR
line: As hot as Perseus, spur thy Phrygian steed,

scene: SCENE V.  The Grecian camp. Lists set out.
speaker: NESTOR
line: Despising many forfeits and subduements,

scene: SCENE V.  The Grecian camp. Lists set out.
speaker: NESTOR
line: When thou hast hung thy advanced sword i' the air,

scene: SCENE V.  The Grecian camp. Lists set out.
speaker: NESTOR
line: Not letting it decline on the declined,

scene: SCENE V.  The Grecian camp. Lists set out.
speaker: NESTOR
line: That I have said to some my standers by

scene: SCENE V.  The Grecian camp. Lists set out.
speaker: NESTOR
line: 'Lo, Jupiter is yonder, dealing life!'

scene: SCENE V.  The Grecian camp. Lists set out.
speaker: NESTOR
line: And I have seen thee pause and take thy breath,

scene: SCENE V.  The Grecian camp. Lists set out.
speaker: NESTOR
line: When that a ring of Greeks have hemm'd thee in,

scene: SCENE V.  The Grecian camp. Lists set out.
speaker: NESTOR
line: Like an Olympian wrestling: this have I seen;

scene: SCENE V.  The Grecian camp. Lists set out.
speaker: NESTOR
line: But this thy countenance, still lock'd in steel,

scene: SCENE V.  The Grecian camp. Lists set out.
speaker: NESTOR
line: I never saw till now. I knew thy grandsire,

scene: SCENE V.  The Grecian camp. Lists set out.
speaker: NESTOR
line: And once fought with him: he was a soldier good;

scene: SCENE V.  The Grecian camp. Lists set out.
speaker: NESTOR
line: But, by great Mars, the captain of us all,

scene: SCENE V.  The Grecian camp. Lists set out.
speaker: NESTOR
line: Never saw like thee. Let an old man embrace thee;

scene: SCENE V.  The Grecian camp. Lists set out.
speaker: NESTOR
line: And, worthy warrior, welcome to our tents.

scene: SCENE V.  The Grecian camp. Lists set out.
speaker: AENEAS
line: 'Tis the old Nestor.

scene: SCENE V.  The Grecian camp. Lists set out.
speaker: HECTOR
line: Let me embrace thee, good old chronicle,

scene: SCENE V.  The Grecian camp. Lists set out.
speaker: HECTOR
line: That hast so long walk'd hand in hand with time:

scene: SCENE V.  The Grecian camp. Lists set out.
speaker: HECTOR
line: Most reverend Nestor, I am glad to clasp thee.

scene: SCENE V.  The Grecian camp. Lists set out.
speaker: NESTOR
line: I would my arms could match thee in contention,

scene: SCENE V.  The Grecian camp. Lists set out.
speaker: NESTOR
line: As they contend with thee in courtesy.

scene: SCENE V.  The Grecian camp. Lists set out.
speaker: HECTOR
line: I would they could.

scene: SCENE V.  The Grecian camp. Lists set out.
speaker: NESTOR
line: Ha!

scene: SCENE V.  The Grecian camp. Lists set out.
speaker: NESTOR
line: By this white beard, I'ld fight with thee to-morrow.

scene: SCENE V.  The Grecian camp. Lists set out.
speaker: NESTOR
line: Well, welcome, welcome! I have seen the time.

scene: SCENE V.  The Grecian camp. Lists set out.
speaker: ULYSSES
line: I wonder now how yonder city stands

scene: SCENE V.  The Grecian camp. Lists set out.
speaker: ULYSSES
line: When we have here her base and pillar by us.

scene: SCENE V.  The Grecian camp. Lists set out.
speaker: HECTOR
line: I know your favour, Lord Ulysses, well.

scene: SCENE V.  The Grecian camp. Lists set out.
speaker: HECTOR
line: Ah, sir, there's many a Greek and Trojan dead,

scene: SCENE V.  The Grecian camp. Lists set out.
speaker: HECTOR
line: Since first I saw yourself and Diomed

scene: SCENE V.  The Grecian camp. Lists set out.
speaker: HECTOR
line: In Ilion, on your Greekish embassy.

scene: SCENE V.  The Grecian camp. Lists set out.
speaker: ULYSSES
line: Sir, I foretold you then what would ensue:

scene: SCENE V.  The Grecian camp. Lists set out.
speaker: ULYSSES
line: My prophecy is but half his journey yet;

scene: SCENE V.  The Grecian camp. Lists set out.
speaker: ULYSSES
line: For yonder walls, that pertly front your town,

scene: SCENE V.  The Grecian camp. Lists set out.
speaker: ULYSSES
line: Yond towers, whose wanton tops do buss the clouds,

scene: SCENE V.  The Grecian camp. Lists set out.
speaker: ULYSSES
line: Must kiss their own feet.

scene: SCENE V.  The Grecian camp. Lists set out.
speaker: HECTOR
line: I must not believe you:

scene: SCENE V.  The Grecian camp. Lists set out.
speaker: HECTOR
line: There they stand yet, and modestly I think,

scene: SCENE V.  The Grecian camp. Lists set out.
speaker: HECTOR
line: The fall of every Phrygian stone will cost

scene: SCENE V.  The Grecian camp. Lists set out.
speaker: HECTOR
line: A drop of Grecian blood: the end crowns all,

scene: SCENE V.  The Grecian camp. Lists set out.
speaker: HECTOR
line: And that old common arbitrator, Time,

scene: SCENE V.  The Grecian camp. Lists set out.
speaker: HECTOR
line: Will one day end it.

scene: SCENE V.  The Grecian camp. Lists set out.
speaker: ULYSSES
line: So to him we leave it.

scene: SCENE V.  The Grecian camp. Lists set out.
speaker: ULYSSES
line: Most gentle and most valiant Hector, welcome:

scene: SCENE V.  The Grecian camp. Lists set out.
speaker: ULYSSES
line: After the general, I beseech you next

scene: SCENE V.  The Grecian camp. Lists set out.
speaker: ULYSSES
line: To feast with me and see me at my tent.

scene: SCENE V.  The Grecian camp. Lists set out.
speaker: ACHILLES
line: I shall forestall thee, Lord Ulysses, thou!

scene: SCENE V.  The Grecian camp. Lists set out.
speaker: ACHILLES
line: Now, Hector, I have fed mine eyes on thee;

scene: SCENE V.  The Grecian camp. Lists set out.
speaker: ACHILLES
line: I have with exact view perused thee, Hector,

scene: SCENE V.  The Grecian camp. Lists set out.
speaker: ACHILLES
line: And quoted joint by joint.

scene: SCENE V.  The Grecian camp. Lists set out.
speaker: HECTOR
line: Is this Achilles?

scene: SCENE V.  The Grecian camp. Lists set out.
speaker: ACHILLES
line: I am Achilles.

scene: SCENE V.  The Grecian camp. Lists set out.
speaker: HECTOR
line: Stand fair, I pray thee: let me look on thee.

scene: SCENE V.  The Grecian camp. Lists set out.
speaker: ACHILLES
line: Behold thy fill.

scene: SCENE V.  The Grecian camp. Lists set out.
speaker: HECTOR
line: Nay, I have done already.

scene: SCENE V.  The Grecian camp. Lists set out.
speaker: ACHILLES
line: Thou art too brief: I will the second time,

scene: SCENE V.  The Grecian camp. Lists set out.
speaker: ACHILLES
line: As I would buy thee, view thee limb by limb.

scene: SCENE V.  The Grecian camp. Lists set out.
speaker: HECTOR
line: O, like a book of sport thou'lt read me o'er;

scene: SCENE V.  The Grecian camp. Lists set out.
speaker: HECTOR
line: But there's more in me than thou understand'st.

scene: SCENE V.  The Grecian camp. Lists set out.
speaker: HECTOR
line: Why dost thou so oppress me with thine eye?

scene: SCENE V.  The Grecian camp. Lists set out.
speaker: ACHILLES
line: Tell me, you heavens, in which part of his body

scene: SCENE V.  The Grecian camp. Lists set out.
speaker: ACHILLES
line: Shall I destroy him? whether there, or there, or there?

scene: SCENE V.  The Grecian camp. Lists set out.
speaker: ACHILLES
line: That I may give the local wound a name

scene: SCENE V.  The Grecian camp. Lists set out.
speaker: ACHILLES
line: And make distinct the very breach whereout

scene: SCENE V.  The Grecian camp. Lists set out.
speaker: ACHILLES
line: Hector's great spirit flew: answer me, heavens!

scene: SCENE V.  The Grecian camp. Lists set out.
speaker: HECTOR
line: It would discredit the blest gods, proud man,

scene: SCENE V.  The Grecian camp. Lists set out.
speaker: HECTOR
line: To answer such a question: stand again:

scene: SCENE V.  The Grecian camp. Lists set out.
speaker: HECTOR
line: Think'st thou to catch my life so pleasantly

scene: SCENE V.  The Grecian camp. Lists set out.
speaker: HECTOR
line: As to prenominate in nice conjecture

scene: SCENE V.  The Grecian camp. Lists set out.
speaker: HECTOR
line: Where thou wilt hit me dead?

scene: SCENE V.  The Grecian camp. Lists set out.
speaker: ACHILLES
line: I tell thee, yea.

scene: SCENE V.  The Grecian camp. Lists set out.
speaker: HECTOR
line: Wert thou an oracle to tell me so,

scene: SCENE V.  The Grecian camp. Lists set out.
speaker: HECTOR
line: I'd not believe thee. Henceforth guard thee well;

scene: SCENE V.  The Grecian camp. Lists set out.
speaker: HECTOR
line: For I'll not kill thee there, nor there, nor there;

scene: SCENE V.  The Grecian camp. Lists set out.
speaker: HECTOR
line: But, by the forge that stithied Mars his helm,

scene: SCENE V.  The Grecian camp. Lists set out.
speaker: HECTOR
line: I'll kill thee every where, yea, o'er and o'er.

scene: SCENE V.  The Grecian camp. Lists set out.
speaker: HECTOR
line: You wisest Grecians, pardon me this brag;

scene: SCENE V.  The Grecian camp. Lists set out.
speaker: HECTOR
line: His insolence draws folly from my lips;

scene: SCENE V.  The Grecian camp. Lists set out.
speaker: HECTOR
line: But I'll endeavour deeds to match these words,

scene: SCENE V.  The Grecian camp. Lists set out.
speaker: HECTOR
line: Or may I never--

scene: SCENE V.  The Grecian camp. Lists set out.
speaker: AJAX
line: Do not chafe thee, cousin:

scene: SCENE V.  The Grecian camp. Lists set out.
speaker: AJAX
line: And you, Achilles, let these threats alone,

scene: SCENE V.  The Grecian camp. Lists set out.
speaker: AJAX

scene: SCENE V.  The Grecian camp. Lists set out.
speaker: AJAX
line: You may have every day enough of Hector

scene: SCENE V.  The Grecian camp. Lists set out.
speaker: AJAX

scene: SCENE V.  The Grecian camp. Lists set out.
speaker: AJAX
line: Can scarce entreat you to be odd with him.

line: I pray you, let us see you in the field:

scene: SCENE V.  The Grecian camp. Lists set out.

line: The Grecians' cause.

line: Dost thou entreat me, Hector?

scene: SCENE V.  The Grecian camp. Lists set out.

line: To-morrow do I meet thee, fell as death;

speaker: HECTOR

scene: SCENE V.  The Grecian camp. Lists set out.
speaker: TROILUS
line: But still sweet love is food for fortune's tooth.
