line: she's noted.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Before Calchas' tent.
speaker: DIOMEDES
line: Will you remember?

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Before Calchas' tent.
speaker: CRESSIDA
line: Remember! yes.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Before Calchas' tent.
speaker: DIOMEDES
line: Nay, but do, then;

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Before Calchas' tent.
speaker: DIOMEDES
line: And let your mind be coupled with your words.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Before Calchas' tent.
speaker: TROILUS
line: What should she remember?

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Before Calchas' tent.
speaker: ULYSSES
line: List.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Before Calchas' tent.
speaker: CRESSIDA
line: Sweet honey Greek, tempt me no more to folly.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Before Calchas' tent.
speaker: THERSITES
line: Roguery!

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Before Calchas' tent.
speaker: DIOMEDES
line: Nay, then,--

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Before Calchas' tent.
speaker: CRESSIDA
line: I'll tell you what,--

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Before Calchas' tent.
speaker: DIOMEDES
line: Foh, foh! come, tell a pin: you are forsworn.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Before Calchas' tent.
speaker: CRESSIDA
line: In faith, I cannot: what would you have me do?

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Before Calchas' tent.
speaker: THERSITES
line: A juggling trick,--to be secretly open.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Before Calchas' tent.
speaker: DIOMEDES
line: What did you swear you would bestow on me?

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Before Calchas' tent.
speaker: CRESSIDA
line: I prithee, do not hold me to mine oath;

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Before Calchas' tent.
speaker: CRESSIDA
line: Bid me do any thing but that, sweet Greek.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Before Calchas' tent.
speaker: DIOMEDES
line: Good night.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Before Calchas' tent.
speaker: TROILUS
line: Hold, patience!

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Before Calchas' tent.
speaker: ULYSSES
line: How now, Trojan!

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Before Calchas' tent.
speaker: CRESSIDA
line: Diomed,--

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Before Calchas' tent.
speaker: DIOMEDES
line: No, no, good night: I'll be your fool no more.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Before Calchas' tent.
speaker: TROILUS
line: Thy better must.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Before Calchas' tent.
speaker: CRESSIDA
line: Hark, one word in your ear.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Before Calchas' tent.
speaker: TROILUS
line: O plague and madness!

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Before Calchas' tent.
speaker: ULYSSES
line: You are moved, prince; let us depart, I pray you,

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Before Calchas' tent.
speaker: ULYSSES
line: Lest your displeasure should enlarge itself

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Before Calchas' tent.
speaker: ULYSSES
line: To wrathful terms: this place is dangerous;

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Before Calchas' tent.
speaker: ULYSSES
line: The time right deadly; I beseech you, go.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Before Calchas' tent.
speaker: TROILUS
line: Behold, I pray you!

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Before Calchas' tent.
speaker: ULYSSES
line: Nay, good my lord, go off:

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Before Calchas' tent.
speaker: ULYSSES
line: You flow to great distraction; come, my lord.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Before Calchas' tent.
speaker: TROILUS
line: I pray thee, stay.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Before Calchas' tent.
speaker: ULYSSES
line: You have not patience; come.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Before Calchas' tent.
speaker: TROILUS
line: I pray you, stay; by hell and all hell's torments

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Before Calchas' tent.
speaker: TROILUS
line: I will not speak a word!

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Before Calchas' tent.
speaker: DIOMEDES
line: And so, good night.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Before Calchas' tent.
speaker: CRESSIDA
line: Nay, but you part in anger.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Before Calchas' tent.
speaker: TROILUS
line: Doth that grieve thee?

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Before Calchas' tent.
speaker: TROILUS
line: O wither'd truth!

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Before Calchas' tent.
speaker: ULYSSES
line: Why, how now, lord!

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Before Calchas' tent.
speaker: TROILUS
line: By Jove,

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Before Calchas' tent.
speaker: TROILUS
line: I will be patient.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Before Calchas' tent.
speaker: CRESSIDA
line: Guardian!--why, Greek!

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Before Calchas' tent.
speaker: DIOMEDES
line: Foh, foh! adieu; you palter.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Before Calchas' tent.
speaker: CRESSIDA
line: In faith, I do not: come hither once again.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Before Calchas' tent.
speaker: ULYSSES
line: You shake, my lord, at something: will you go?

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Before Calchas' tent.
speaker: ULYSSES
line: You will break out.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Before Calchas' tent.
speaker: TROILUS
line: She strokes his cheek!

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Before Calchas' tent.
speaker: ULYSSES
line: Come, come.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Before Calchas' tent.
speaker: TROILUS
line: Nay, stay; by Jove, I will not speak a word:

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Before Calchas' tent.
speaker: TROILUS
line: There is between my will and all offences

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Before Calchas' tent.
speaker: TROILUS
line: A guard of patience: stay a little while.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Before Calchas' tent.
speaker: THERSITES
line: How the devil Luxury, with his fat rump and

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Before Calchas' tent.
speaker: THERSITES
line: potato-finger, tickles these together! Fry, lechery, fry!

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Before Calchas' tent.
speaker: DIOMEDES
line: But will you, then?

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Before Calchas' tent.
speaker: CRESSIDA
line: In faith, I will, la; never trust me else.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Before Calchas' tent.
speaker: DIOMEDES
line: Give me some token for the surety of it.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Before Calchas' tent.
speaker: CRESSIDA
line: I'll fetch you one.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Before Calchas' tent.
speaker: ULYSSES
line: You have sworn patience.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Before Calchas' tent.
speaker: TROILUS
line: Fear me not, sweet lord;

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Before Calchas' tent.
speaker: TROILUS
line: I will not be myself, nor have cognition

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Before Calchas' tent.
speaker: TROILUS
line: Of what I feel: I am all patience.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Before Calchas' tent.
speaker: THERSITES
line: Now the pledge; now, now, now!

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Before Calchas' tent.
speaker: CRESSIDA
line: Here, Diomed, keep this sleeve.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Before Calchas' tent.
speaker: TROILUS
line: O beauty! where is thy faith?

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Before Calchas' tent.
speaker: ULYSSES
line: My lord,--

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Before Calchas' tent.
speaker: TROILUS
line: I will be patient; outwardly I will.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Before Calchas' tent.
speaker: CRESSIDA
line: You look upon that sleeve; behold it well.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Before Calchas' tent.
speaker: CRESSIDA
line: He loved me--O false wench!--Give't me again.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Before Calchas' tent.
speaker: DIOMEDES
line: Whose was't?

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Before Calchas' tent.
speaker: CRESSIDA
line: It is no matter, now I have't again.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Before Calchas' tent.
speaker: CRESSIDA
line: I will not meet with you to-morrow night:

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Before Calchas' tent.
speaker: CRESSIDA
line: I prithee, Diomed, visit me no more.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Before Calchas' tent.
speaker: THERSITES
line: Now she sharpens: well said, whetstone!

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Before Calchas' tent.
speaker: DIOMEDES
line: I shall have it.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Before Calchas' tent.
speaker: CRESSIDA
line: What, this?

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Before Calchas' tent.
speaker: DIOMEDES
line: Ay, that.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Before Calchas' tent.
speaker: CRESSIDA
line: O, all you gods! O pretty, pretty pledge!

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Before Calchas' tent.
speaker: CRESSIDA
line: Thy master now lies thinking in his bed

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Before Calchas' tent.
speaker: CRESSIDA
line: Of thee and me, and sighs, and takes my glove,

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Before Calchas' tent.
speaker: CRESSIDA
line: And gives memorial dainty kisses to it,

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Before Calchas' tent.
speaker: CRESSIDA
line: As I kiss thee. Nay, do not snatch it from me;

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Before Calchas' tent.
speaker: CRESSIDA
line: He that takes that doth take my heart withal.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Before Calchas' tent.
speaker: DIOMEDES
line: I had your heart before, this follows it.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Before Calchas' tent.
speaker: TROILUS
line: I did swear patience.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Before Calchas' tent.
speaker: CRESSIDA
line: You shall not have it, Diomed; faith, you shall not;

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Before Calchas' tent.
speaker: CRESSIDA
line: I'll give you something else.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Before Calchas' tent.
speaker: DIOMEDES
line: I will have this: whose was it?

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Before Calchas' tent.
speaker: CRESSIDA
line: It is no matter.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Before Calchas' tent.
speaker: DIOMEDES
line: Come, tell me whose it was.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Before Calchas' tent.
speaker: CRESSIDA
line: 'Twas one's that loved me better than you will.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Before Calchas' tent.
speaker: CRESSIDA
line: But, now you have it, take it.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Before Calchas' tent.
speaker: DIOMEDES
line: Whose was it?

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Before Calchas' tent.
speaker: CRESSIDA
line: By all Diana's waiting-women yond,

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Before Calchas' tent.
speaker: CRESSIDA
line: And by herself, I will not tell you whose.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Before Calchas' tent.
speaker: DIOMEDES
line: To-morrow will I wear it on my helm,

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Before Calchas' tent.
speaker: DIOMEDES
line: And grieve his spirit that dares not challenge it.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Before Calchas' tent.
speaker: TROILUS
line: Wert thou the devil, and worest it on thy horn,

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Before Calchas' tent.
speaker: TROILUS
line: It should be challenged.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Before Calchas' tent.
speaker: CRESSIDA
line: Well, well, 'tis done, 'tis past: and yet it is not;

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Before Calchas' tent.
speaker: CRESSIDA
line: I will not keep my word.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Before Calchas' tent.
speaker: DIOMEDES
line: Why, then, farewell;

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Before Calchas' tent.
speaker: DIOMEDES
line: Thou never shalt mock Diomed again.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Before Calchas' tent.
speaker: CRESSIDA
line: You shall not go: one cannot speak a word,

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Before Calchas' tent.
speaker: CRESSIDA
line: But it straight starts you.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Before Calchas' tent.
speaker: DIOMEDES
line: I do not like this fooling.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Before Calchas' tent.
speaker: THERSITES
line: Nor I, by Pluto: but that that likes not you pleases me best.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Before Calchas' tent.
speaker: DIOMEDES
line: What, shall I come? the hour?

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Before Calchas' tent.
speaker: CRESSIDA
line: Ay, come:--O Jove!--do come:--I shall be plagued.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Before Calchas' tent.
speaker: DIOMEDES
line: Farewell till then.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Before Calchas' tent.
speaker: CRESSIDA
line: Good night: I prithee, come.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Before Calchas' tent.
speaker: CRESSIDA
line: Troilus, farewell! one eye yet looks on thee

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Before Calchas' tent.
speaker: CRESSIDA
line: But with my heart the other eye doth see.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Before Calchas' tent.
speaker: CRESSIDA
line: Ah, poor our sex! this fault in us I find,

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Before Calchas' tent.
speaker: CRESSIDA
line: The error of our eye directs our mind:

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Before Calchas' tent.
speaker: CRESSIDA
line: What error leads must err; O, then conclude

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Before Calchas' tent.
speaker: CRESSIDA
line: Minds sway'd by eyes are full of turpitude.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Before Calchas' tent.
speaker: THERSITES
line: A proof of strength she could not publish more,

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Before Calchas' tent.
speaker: THERSITES
line: Unless she said ' My mind is now turn'd whore.'

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Before Calchas' tent.
speaker: ULYSSES
line: All's done, my lord.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Before Calchas' tent.
speaker: TROILUS
line: It is.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Before Calchas' tent.
speaker: ULYSSES
line: Why stay we, then?

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Before Calchas' tent.
speaker: TROILUS
line: To make a recordation to my soul

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Before Calchas' tent.
speaker: TROILUS
line: Of every syllable that here was spoke.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Before Calchas' tent.
speaker: TROILUS
line: But if I tell how these two did co-act,

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Before Calchas' tent.
speaker: TROILUS
line: Shall I not lie in publishing a truth?

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Before Calchas' tent.
speaker: TROILUS
line: Sith yet there is a credence in my heart,

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Before Calchas' tent.
speaker: TROILUS
line: An esperance so obstinately strong,

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Before Calchas' tent.
speaker: TROILUS
line: That doth invert the attest of eyes and ears,

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Before Calchas' tent.
speaker: TROILUS
line: As if those organs had deceptious functions,

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Before Calchas' tent.
speaker: TROILUS
line: Created only to calumniate.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Before Calchas' tent.
speaker: TROILUS
line: Was Cressid here?

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Before Calchas' tent.
speaker: ULYSSES
line: I cannot conjure, Trojan.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Before Calchas' tent.
speaker: TROILUS
line: She was not, sure.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Before Calchas' tent.
speaker: ULYSSES
line: Most sure she was.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Before Calchas' tent.
speaker: TROILUS
line: Why, my negation hath no taste of madness.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Before Calchas' tent.
speaker: ULYSSES
line: Nor mine, my lord: Cressid was here but now.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Before Calchas' tent.
speaker: TROILUS
line: Let it not be believed for womanhood!

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Before Calchas' tent.
speaker: TROILUS
line: Think, we had mothers; do not give advantage

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Before Calchas' tent.
speaker: TROILUS
line: To stubborn critics, apt, without a theme,

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Before Calchas' tent.
speaker: TROILUS
line: For depravation, to square the general sex

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Before Calchas' tent.
speaker: TROILUS
line: By Cressid's rule: rather think this not Cressid.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Before Calchas' tent.
speaker: ULYSSES
line: What hath she done, prince, that can soil our mothers?

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Before Calchas' tent.
speaker: TROILUS
line: Nothing at all, unless that this were she.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Before Calchas' tent.
speaker: THERSITES
line: Will he swagger himself out on's own eyes?

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Before Calchas' tent.
speaker: TROILUS
line: This she? no, this is Diomed's Cressida:

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Before Calchas' tent.
speaker: TROILUS
line: If beauty have a soul, this is not she;

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Before Calchas' tent.
speaker: TROILUS
line: If souls guide vows, if vows be sanctimonies,

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Before Calchas' tent.
speaker: TROILUS
line: If sanctimony be the gods' delight,

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Before Calchas' tent.
speaker: TROILUS
line: If there be rule in unity itself,

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Before Calchas' tent.
speaker: TROILUS
line: This is not she. O madness of discourse,

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Before Calchas' tent.
speaker: TROILUS
line: That cause sets up with and against itself!

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Before Calchas' tent.
speaker: TROILUS
line: Bi-fold authority! where reason can revolt

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Before Calchas' tent.
speaker: TROILUS
line: Without perdition, and loss assume all reason

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Before Calchas' tent.
speaker: TROILUS
line: Without revolt: this is, and is not, Cressid.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Before Calchas' tent.
speaker: TROILUS
line: Within my soul there doth conduce a fight

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Before Calchas' tent.
speaker: TROILUS
line: Of this strange nature that a thing inseparate

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Before Calchas' tent.
speaker: TROILUS
line: Divides more wider than the sky and earth,

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Before Calchas' tent.
speaker: TROILUS
line: And yet the spacious breadth of this division

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Before Calchas' tent.
speaker: TROILUS
line: Admits no orifex for a point as subtle

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Before Calchas' tent.
speaker: TROILUS
line: As Ariachne's broken woof to enter.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Before Calchas' tent.
speaker: TROILUS
line: Instance, O instance! strong as Pluto's gates;

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Before Calchas' tent.
speaker: TROILUS
line: Cressid is mine, tied with the bonds of heaven:

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Before Calchas' tent.
speaker: TROILUS
line: Instance, O instance! strong as heaven itself;

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Before Calchas' tent.
speaker: TROILUS
line: The bonds of heaven are slipp'd, dissolved, and loosed;

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Before Calchas' tent.
speaker: TROILUS
line: And with another knot, five-finger-tied,

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Before Calchas' tent.
speaker: TROILUS
line: The fractions of her faith, orts of her love,

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Before Calchas' tent.
speaker: TROILUS
line: The fragments, scraps, the bits and greasy relics

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Before Calchas' tent.
speaker: TROILUS
line: Of her o'er-eaten faith, are bound to Diomed.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Before Calchas' tent.
speaker: ULYSSES
line: May worthy Troilus be half attach'd

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Before Calchas' tent.
speaker: ULYSSES
line: With that which here his passion doth express?

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Before Calchas' tent.
speaker: TROILUS
line: Ay, Greek; and that shall be divulged well

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Before Calchas' tent.
speaker: TROILUS
line: In characters as red as Mars his heart

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Before Calchas' tent.
speaker: TROILUS
line: Inflamed with Venus: never did young man fancy

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Before Calchas' tent.
speaker: TROILUS
line: With so eternal and so fix'd a soul.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Before Calchas' tent.
speaker: TROILUS
line: Hark, Greek: as much as I do Cressid love,

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Before Calchas' tent.
speaker: TROILUS
line: So much by weight hate I her Diomed:

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Before Calchas' tent.
speaker: TROILUS
line: That sleeve is mine that he'll bear on his helm;

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Before Calchas' tent.
speaker: TROILUS
line: Were it a casque composed by Vulcan's skill,

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Before Calchas' tent.
speaker: TROILUS
line: My sword should bite it: not the dreadful spout

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Before Calchas' tent.
speaker: TROILUS
line: Which shipmen do the hurricano call,

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Before Calchas' tent.
speaker: TROILUS
line: Constringed in mass by the almighty sun,

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Before Calchas' tent.
speaker: TROILUS
line: Shall dizzy with more clamour Neptune's ear

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Before Calchas' tent.
speaker: TROILUS
line: In his descent than shall my prompted sword

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Before Calchas' tent.
speaker: TROILUS
line: Falling on Diomed.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Before Calchas' tent.
speaker: THERSITES
line: He'll tickle it for his concupy.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Before Calchas' tent.
speaker: TROILUS
line: O Cressid! O false Cressid! false, false, false!

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Before Calchas' tent.
speaker: TROILUS
line: Let all untruths stand by thy stained name,

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Before Calchas' tent.
speaker: TROILUS
line: And they'll seem glorious.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Before Calchas' tent.
speaker: ULYSSES
line: O, contain yourself

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Before Calchas' tent.
speaker: ULYSSES
line: Your passion draws ears hither.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Before Calchas' tent.
speaker: AENEAS
line: I have been seeking you this hour, my lord:

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Before Calchas' tent.
speaker: AENEAS
line: Hector, by this, is arming him in Troy;

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Before Calchas' tent.
speaker: AENEAS
line: Ajax, your guard, stays to conduct you home.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Before Calchas' tent.
speaker: TROILUS
line: Have with you, prince. My courteous lord, adieu.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Before Calchas' tent.
speaker: TROILUS
line: Farewell, revolted fair! and, Diomed,

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Before Calchas' tent.
speaker: TROILUS
line: Stand fast, and wear a castle on thy head!

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Before Calchas' tent.
speaker: ULYSSES
line: I'll bring you to the gates.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Before Calchas' tent.
speaker: TROILUS
line: Accept distracted thanks.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Before Calchas' tent.
speaker: THERSITES
line: Would I could meet that rogue Diomed! I would

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Before Calchas' tent.
speaker: THERSITES
line: croak like a raven; I would bode, I would bode.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Before Calchas' tent.
speaker: THERSITES
line: Patroclus will give me any thing for the

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Before Calchas' tent.
speaker: THERSITES
line: intelligence of this whore: the parrot will not

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Before Calchas' tent.
speaker: THERSITES
line: do more for an almond than he for a commodious drab.

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Before Calchas' tent.
speaker: THERSITES
line: Lechery, lechery; still, wars and lechery; nothing

scene: SCENE II.  The same. Before Calchas' tent.
speaker: THERSITES
line: else holds fashion: a burning devil take them!

scene: SCENE III.  Troy. Before Priam's palace.
speaker: ANDROMACHE
line: When was my lord so much ungently temper'd,

scene: SCENE III.  Troy. Before Priam's palace.
speaker: ANDROMACHE
line: To stop his ears against admonishment?

scene: SCENE III.  Troy. Before Priam's palace.
speaker: ANDROMACHE
line: Unarm, unarm, and do not fight to-day.

scene: SCENE III.  Troy. Before Priam's palace.
speaker: HECTOR
line: You train me to offend you; get you in:

scene: SCENE III.  Troy. Before Priam's palace.
speaker: HECTOR
line: By all the everlasting gods, I'll go!

scene: SCENE III.  Troy. Before Priam's palace.
speaker: ANDROMACHE
line: My dreams will, sure, prove ominous to the day.

scene: SCENE III.  Troy. Before Priam's palace.
speaker: HECTOR
line: No more, I say.

scene: SCENE III.  Troy. Before Priam's palace.
speaker: CASSANDRA
line: Where is my brother Hector?

scene: SCENE III.  Troy. Before Priam's palace.
speaker: ANDROMACHE
line: Here, sister; arm'd, and bloody in intent.

scene: SCENE III.  Troy. Before Priam's palace.
speaker: ANDROMACHE
line: Consort with me in loud and dear petition,

scene: SCENE III.  Troy. Before Priam's palace.
speaker: ANDROMACHE
line: Pursue we him on knees; for I have dream'd

scene: SCENE III.  Troy. Before Priam's palace.
speaker: ANDROMACHE
line: Of bloody turbulence, and this whole night

scene: SCENE III.  Troy. Before Priam's palace.
speaker: ANDROMACHE
line: Hath nothing been but shapes and forms of slaughter.

scene: SCENE III.  Troy. Before Priam's palace.
speaker: CASSANDRA
line: O, 'tis true.

scene: SCENE III.  Troy. Before Priam's palace.
speaker: HECTOR
line: Ho! bid my trumpet sound!

scene: SCENE III.  Troy. Before Priam's palace.
speaker: CASSANDRA
line: No notes of sally, for the heavens, sweet brother.

scene: SCENE III.  Troy. Before Priam's palace.
speaker: HECTOR
line: Be gone, I say: the gods have heard me swear.

scene: SCENE III.  Troy. Before Priam's palace.
speaker: CASSANDRA
line: The gods are deaf to hot and peevish vows:

scene: SCENE III.  Troy. Before Priam's palace.
speaker: CASSANDRA
line: They are polluted offerings, more abhorr'd

scene: SCENE III.  Troy. Before Priam's palace.
speaker: CASSANDRA
line: Than spotted livers in the sacrifice.

scene: SCENE III.  Troy. Before Priam's palace.
speaker: ANDROMACHE
line: O, be persuaded! do not count it holy

scene: SCENE III.  Troy. Before Priam's palace.
speaker: ANDROMACHE
line: To hurt by being just: it is as lawful,

scene: SCENE III.  Troy. Before Priam's palace.
speaker: ANDROMACHE
line: For we would give much, to use violent thefts,

scene: SCENE III.  Troy. Before Priam's palace.
speaker: ANDROMACHE
line: And rob in the behalf of charity.

scene: SCENE III.  Troy. Before Priam's palace.
speaker: CASSANDRA
line: It is the purpose that makes strong the vow;

scene: SCENE III.  Troy. Before Priam's palace.
speaker: CASSANDRA
line: But vows to every purpose must not hold:

scene: SCENE III.  Troy. Before Priam's palace.
speaker: CASSANDRA
line: Unarm, sweet Hector.

scene: SCENE III.  Troy. Before Priam's palace.
speaker: HECTOR
line: Hold you still, I say;

scene: SCENE III.  Troy. Before Priam's palace.
speaker: HECTOR
line: Mine honour keeps the weather of my fate:

scene: SCENE III.  Troy. Before Priam's palace.
speaker: HECTOR
line: Lie every man holds dear; but the brave man

scene: SCENE III.  Troy. Before Priam's palace.
speaker: HECTOR
line: Holds honour far more precious-dear than life.

scene: SCENE III.  Troy. Before Priam's palace.
speaker: HECTOR
line: How now, young man! mean'st thou to fight to-day?

scene: SCENE III.  Troy. Before Priam's palace.
speaker: ANDROMACHE
line: Cassandra, call my father to persuade.

scene: SCENE III.  Troy. Before Priam's palace.
speaker: HECTOR
line: No, faith, young Troilus; doff thy harness, youth;

scene: SCENE III.  Troy. Before Priam's palace.
speaker: HECTOR
line: I am to-day i' the vein of chivalry:

scene: SCENE III.  Troy. Before Priam's palace.
speaker: HECTOR
line: Let grow thy sinews till their knots be strong,

scene: SCENE III.  Troy. Before Priam's palace.
speaker: HECTOR
line: And tempt not yet the brushes of the war.

scene: SCENE III.  Troy. Before Priam's palace.
speaker: HECTOR
line: Unarm thee, go, and doubt thou not, brave boy,

scene: SCENE III.  Troy. Before Priam's palace.
speaker: HECTOR
line: I'll stand to-day for thee and me and Troy.

scene: SCENE III.  Troy. Before Priam's palace.
speaker: TROILUS
line: Brother, you have a vice of mercy in you,

scene: SCENE III.  Troy. Before Priam's palace.
speaker: TROILUS
line: Which better fits a lion than a man.

scene: SCENE III.  Troy. Before Priam's palace.
speaker: HECTOR
line: What vice is that, good Troilus? chide me for it.

scene: SCENE III.  Troy. Before Priam's palace.
speaker: TROILUS
line: When many times the captive Grecian falls,

scene: SCENE III.  Troy. Before Priam's palace.
speaker: TROILUS
line: Even in the fan and wind of your fair sword,

scene: SCENE III.  Troy. Before Priam's palace.
speaker: TROILUS
line: You bid them rise, and live.

scene: SCENE III.  Troy. Before Priam's palace.
speaker: HECTOR
line: O,'tis fair play.

scene: SCENE III.  Troy. Before Priam's palace.
speaker: TROILUS
line: Fool's play, by heaven, Hector.

scene: SCENE III.  Troy. Before Priam's palace.
speaker: HECTOR
line: How now! how now!

scene: SCENE III.  Troy. Before Priam's palace.
speaker: TROILUS
line: For the love of all the gods,

scene: SCENE III.  Troy. Before Priam's palace.
speaker: TROILUS
line: Let's leave the hermit pity with our mothers,

scene: SCENE III.  Troy. Before Priam's palace.
speaker: TROILUS
line: And when we have our armours buckled on,

scene: SCENE III.  Troy. Before Priam's palace.
speaker: TROILUS
line: The venom'd vengeance ride upon our swords,

scene: SCENE III.  Troy. Before Priam's palace.
speaker: TROILUS
line: Spur them to ruthful work, rein them from ruth.

scene: SCENE III.  Troy. Before Priam's palace.
speaker: HECTOR
line: Fie, savage, fie!

scene: SCENE III.  Troy. Before Priam's palace.
speaker: TROILUS
line: Hector, then 'tis wars.

scene: SCENE III.  Troy. Before Priam's palace.
speaker: HECTOR
line: Troilus, I would not have you fight to-day.

scene: SCENE III.  Troy. Before Priam's palace.
speaker: TROILUS
line: Who should withhold me?

scene: SCENE III.  Troy. Before Priam's palace.
speaker: TROILUS
line: Not fate, obedience, nor the hand of Mars

scene: SCENE III.  Troy. Before Priam's palace.
speaker: TROILUS
line: Beckoning with fiery truncheon my retire;

scene: SCENE III.  Troy. Before Priam's palace.
speaker: TROILUS
line: Not Priamus and Hecuba on knees,

scene: SCENE III.  Troy. Before Priam's palace.
speaker: TROILUS
line: Their eyes o'ergalled with recourse of tears;

scene: SCENE III.  Troy. Before Priam's palace.
speaker: TROILUS
line: Not you, my brother, with your true sword drawn,

scene: SCENE III.  Troy. Before Priam's palace.
speaker: TROILUS
line: Opposed to hinder me, should stop my way,

scene: SCENE III.  Troy. Before Priam's palace.
speaker: TROILUS
line: But by my ruin.

scene: SCENE III.  Troy. Before Priam's palace.
speaker: CASSANDRA
line: Lay hold upon him, Priam, hold him fast:

scene: SCENE III.  Troy. Before Priam's palace.
speaker: CASSANDRA
line: He is thy crutch; now if thou lose thy stay,

scene: SCENE III.  Troy. Before Priam's palace.
speaker: CASSANDRA
line: Thou on him leaning, and all Troy on thee,

scene: SCENE III.  Troy. Before Priam's palace.
speaker: CASSANDRA
line: Fall all together.

scene: SCENE III.  Troy. Before Priam's palace.
speaker: PRIAM
line: Come, Hector, come, go back:

scene: SCENE III.  Troy. Before Priam's palace.
speaker: PRIAM
line: Thy wife hath dream'd; thy mother hath had visions;

scene: SCENE III.  Troy. Before Priam's palace.
speaker: PRIAM
line: Cassandra doth foresee; and I myself

scene: SCENE III.  Troy. Before Priam's palace.
speaker: PRIAM
line: Am like a prophet suddenly enrapt

scene: SCENE III.  Troy. Before Priam's palace.
speaker: PRIAM
line: To tell thee that this day is ominous:

scene: SCENE III.  Troy. Before Priam's palace.
speaker: PRIAM
line: Therefore, come back.

scene: SCENE III.  Troy. Before Priam's palace.
speaker: HECTOR
line: AEneas is a-field;

scene: SCENE III.  Troy. Before Priam's palace.
speaker: HECTOR
line: And I do stand engaged to many Greeks,

scene: SCENE III.  Troy. Before Priam's palace.
speaker: HECTOR
line: Even in the faith of valour, to appear

scene: SCENE III.  Troy. Before Priam's palace.
speaker: HECTOR
line: This morning to them.

scene: SCENE III.  Troy. Before Priam's palace.
speaker: PRIAM
line: Ay, but thou shalt not go.

scene: SCENE III.  Troy. Before Priam's palace.
speaker: HECTOR
line: I must not break my faith.

scene: SCENE III.  Troy. Before Priam's palace.
speaker: HECTOR
line: You know me dutiful; therefore, dear sir,

scene: SCENE III.  Troy. Before Priam's palace.
speaker: HECTOR
line: Let me not shame respect; but give me leave

scene: SCENE III.  Troy. Before Priam's palace.
speaker: HECTOR
line: To take that course by your consent and voice,

scene: SCENE III.  Troy. Before Priam's palace.
speaker: HECTOR
line: Which you do here forbid me, royal Priam.

scene: SCENE III.  Troy. Before Priam's palace.
speaker: CASSANDRA
line: O Priam, yield not to him!

scene: SCENE III.  Troy. Before Priam's palace.
speaker: ANDROMACHE
line: Do not, dear father.

scene: SCENE III.  Troy. Before Priam's palace.
speaker: HECTOR
line: Andromache, I am offended with you:

scene: SCENE III.  Troy. Before Priam's palace.
speaker: HECTOR
line: Upon the love you bear me, get you in.

scene: SCENE III.  Troy. Before Priam's palace.
speaker: TROILUS
line: This foolish, dreaming, superstitious girl

scene: SCENE III.  Troy. Before Priam's palace.
speaker: TROILUS
line: Makes all these bodements.

scene: SCENE III.  Troy. Before Priam's palace.
speaker: CASSANDRA
line: O, farewell, dear Hector!

scene: SCENE III.  Troy. Before Priam's palace.
speaker: CASSANDRA
line: Look, how thou diest! look, how thy eye turns pale!

scene: SCENE III.  Troy. Before Priam's palace.
speaker: CASSANDRA
line: Look, how thy wounds do bleed at many vents!

scene: SCENE III.  Troy. Before Priam's palace.
speaker: CASSANDRA
line: Hark, how Troy roars! how Hecuba cries out!

scene: SCENE III.  Troy. Before Priam's palace.
speaker: CASSANDRA
line: How poor Andromache shrills her dolours forth!

scene: SCENE III.  Troy. Before Priam's palace.
speaker: CASSANDRA
line: Behold, distraction, frenzy and amazement,

scene: SCENE III.  Troy. Before Priam's palace.
speaker: CASSANDRA
line: Like witless antics, one another meet,

scene: SCENE III.  Troy. Before Priam's palace.
speaker: CASSANDRA
line: And all cry, Hector! Hector's dead! O Hector!

scene: SCENE III.  Troy. Before Priam's palace.
speaker: TROILUS
line: Away! away!

scene: SCENE III.  Troy. Before Priam's palace.
speaker: CASSANDRA
line: Farewell: yet, soft! Hector! take my leave:

scene: SCENE III.  Troy. Before Priam's palace.
speaker: CASSANDRA
line: Thou dost thyself and all our Troy deceive.

scene: SCENE III.  Troy. Before Priam's palace.
speaker: HECTOR
line: You are amazed, my liege, at her exclaim:

scene: SCENE III.  Troy. Before Priam's palace.
speaker: HECTOR
line: Go in and cheer the town: we'll forth and fight,

scene: SCENE III.  Troy. Before Priam's palace.
speaker: HECTOR
line: Do deeds worth praise and tell you them at night.

scene: SCENE III.  Troy. Before Priam's palace.
speaker: PRIAM
line: Farewell: the gods with safety stand about thee!

scene: SCENE III.  Troy. Before Priam's palace.
speaker: TROILUS
line: They are at it, hark! Proud Diomed, believe,

scene: SCENE III.  Troy. Before Priam's palace.
speaker: TROILUS
line: I come to lose my arm, or win my sleeve.

scene: SCENE III.  Troy. Before Priam's palace.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: Do you hear, my lord? do you hear?

scene: SCENE III.  Troy. Before Priam's palace.
speaker: TROILUS
line: What now?

scene: SCENE III.  Troy. Before Priam's palace.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: Here's a letter come from yond poor girl.

scene: SCENE III.  Troy. Before Priam's palace.
speaker: TROILUS
line: Let me read.

scene: SCENE III.  Troy. Before Priam's palace.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: A whoreson tisick, a whoreson rascally tisick so

scene: SCENE III.  Troy. Before Priam's palace.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: troubles me, and the foolish fortune of this girl;

scene: SCENE III.  Troy. Before Priam's palace.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: and what one thing, what another, that I shall

scene: SCENE III.  Troy. Before Priam's palace.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: leave you one o' these days: and I have a rheum

scene: SCENE III.  Troy. Before Priam's palace.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: in mine eyes too, and such an ache in my bones

scene: SCENE III.  Troy. Before Priam's palace.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: that, unless a man were cursed, I cannot tell what

scene: SCENE III.  Troy. Before Priam's palace.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: to think on't. What says she there?

scene: SCENE III.  Troy. Before Priam's palace.
speaker: TROILUS
line: Words, words, mere words, no matter from the heart:

scene: SCENE III.  Troy. Before Priam's palace.
speaker: TROILUS
line: The effect doth operate another way.

scene: SCENE III.  Troy. Before Priam's palace.
speaker: TROILUS
line: Go, wind, to wind, there turn and change together.

scene: SCENE III.  Troy. Before Priam's palace.
speaker: TROILUS
line: My love with words and errors still she feeds;

scene: SCENE III.  Troy. Before Priam's palace.
speaker: TROILUS
line: But edifies another with her deeds.

scene: SCENE IV.  Plains between Troy and the Grecian camp.
speaker: THERSITES
line: Now they are clapper-clawing one another; I'll go

scene: SCENE IV.  Plains between Troy and the Grecian camp.
speaker: THERSITES
line: look on. That dissembling abominable varlets Diomed,

scene: SCENE IV.  Plains between Troy and the Grecian camp.
speaker: THERSITES
line: has got that same scurvy doting foolish young knave's

scene: SCENE IV.  Plains between Troy and the Grecian camp.
speaker: THERSITES
line: sleeve of Troy there in his helm: I would fain see

scene: SCENE IV.  Plains between Troy and the Grecian camp.
speaker: THERSITES
line: them meet; that that same young Trojan ass, that

scene: SCENE IV.  Plains between Troy and the Grecian camp.
speaker: THERSITES
line: loves the whore there, might send that Greekish

scene: SCENE IV.  Plains between Troy and the Grecian camp.
speaker: THERSITES
line: whore-masterly villain, with the sleeve, back to the

scene: SCENE IV.  Plains between Troy and the Grecian camp.
speaker: THERSITES
line: dissembling luxurious drab, of a sleeveless errand.

scene: SCENE IV.  Plains between Troy and the Grecian camp.
speaker: THERSITES
line: O' the t'other side, the policy of those crafty

scene: SCENE IV.  Plains between Troy and the Grecian camp.
speaker: THERSITES
line: swearing rascals, that stale old mouse-eaten dry

scene: SCENE IV.  Plains between Troy and the Grecian camp.
speaker: THERSITES
line: cheese, Nestor, and that same dog-fox, Ulysses, is

scene: SCENE IV.  Plains between Troy and the Grecian camp.
speaker: THERSITES
line: not proved worthy a blackberry: they set me up, in

scene: SCENE IV.  Plains between Troy and the Grecian camp.
speaker: THERSITES
line: policy, that mongrel cur, Ajax, against that dog of

scene: SCENE IV.  Plains between Troy and the Grecian camp.
speaker: THERSITES
line: as bad a kind, Achilles: and now is the cur Ajax

scene: SCENE IV.  Plains between Troy and the Grecian camp.
speaker: THERSITES
line: prouder than the cur Achilles, and will not arm

scene: SCENE IV.  Plains between Troy and the Grecian camp.
speaker: THERSITES
line: to-day; whereupon the Grecians begin to proclaim

scene: SCENE IV.  Plains between Troy and the Grecian camp.
speaker: THERSITES
line: barbarism, and policy grows into an ill opinion.

scene: SCENE IV.  Plains between Troy and the Grecian camp.
speaker: THERSITES
line: Soft! here comes sleeve, and t'other.

scene: SCENE IV.  Plains between Troy and the Grecian camp.
speaker: TROILUS
line: Fly not; for shouldst thou take the river Styx,

scene: SCENE IV.  Plains between Troy and the Grecian camp.
speaker: TROILUS
line: I would swim after.

scene: SCENE IV.  Plains between Troy and the Grecian camp.
speaker: DIOMEDES
line: Thou dost miscall retire:

scene: SCENE IV.  Plains between Troy and the Grecian camp.
speaker: DIOMEDES
line: I do not fly, but advantageous care

scene: SCENE IV.  Plains between Troy and the Grecian camp.
speaker: DIOMEDES
line: Withdrew me from the odds of multitude:

scene: SCENE IV.  Plains between Troy and the Grecian camp.
speaker: DIOMEDES
line: Have at thee!

scene: SCENE IV.  Plains between Troy and the Grecian camp.
speaker: THERSITES
line: Hold thy whore, Grecian!--now for thy whore,

scene: SCENE IV.  Plains between Troy and the Grecian camp.
speaker: THERSITES
line: Trojan!--now the sleeve, now the sleeve!

scene: SCENE IV.  Plains between Troy and the Grecian camp.
speaker: HECTOR
line: What art thou, Greek? art thou for Hector's match?

scene: SCENE IV.  Plains between Troy and the Grecian camp.
speaker: HECTOR
line: Art thou of blood and honour?

scene: SCENE IV.  Plains between Troy and the Grecian camp.
speaker: THERSITES
line: No, no, I am a rascal; a scurvy railing knave:

scene: SCENE IV.  Plains between Troy and the Grecian camp.
speaker: THERSITES
line: a very filthy rogue.

scene: SCENE IV.  Plains between Troy and the Grecian camp.
speaker: HECTOR
line: I do believe thee: live.

scene: SCENE IV.  Plains between Troy and the Grecian camp.
speaker: THERSITES
line: God-a-mercy, that thou wilt believe me; but a

scene: SCENE IV.  Plains between Troy and the Grecian camp.
speaker: THERSITES
line: plague break thy neck for frightening me! What's

scene: SCENE IV.  Plains between Troy and the Grecian camp.
speaker: THERSITES
line: become of the wenching rogues? I think they have

scene: SCENE IV.  Plains between Troy and the Grecian camp.
speaker: THERSITES
line: swallowed one another: I would laugh at that

scene: SCENE IV.  Plains between Troy and the Grecian camp.
speaker: THERSITES
line: miracle: yet, in a sort, lechery eats itself.

scene: SCENE IV.  Plains between Troy and the Grecian camp.
speaker: THERSITES
line: I'll seek them.

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the plains.
speaker: DIOMEDES
line: Go, go, my servant, take thou Troilus' horse;

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the plains.
speaker: DIOMEDES
line: Present the fair steed to my lady Cressid:

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the plains.
speaker: DIOMEDES
line: Fellow, commend my service to her beauty;

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the plains.
speaker: DIOMEDES
line: Tell her I have chastised the amorous Trojan,

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the plains.
speaker: DIOMEDES
line: And am her knight by proof.

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the plains.
speaker: Servant
line: I go, my lord.

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the plains.
speaker: AGAMEMNON
line: Renew, renew! The fierce Polydamas

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the plains.
speaker: AGAMEMNON
line: Hath beat down Menon: bastard Margarelon

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the plains.
speaker: AGAMEMNON
line: Hath Doreus prisoner,

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the plains.
speaker: AGAMEMNON
line: And stands colossus-wise, waving his beam,

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the plains.
speaker: AGAMEMNON
line: Upon the pashed corses of the kings

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the plains.
speaker: AGAMEMNON
line: Epistrophus and Cedius: Polyxenes is slain,

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the plains.
speaker: AGAMEMNON
line: Amphimachus and Thoas deadly hurt,

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the plains.
speaker: AGAMEMNON
line: Patroclus ta'en or slain, and Palamedes

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the plains.
speaker: AGAMEMNON
line: Sore hurt and bruised: the dreadful Sagittary

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the plains.
speaker: AGAMEMNON
line: Appals our numbers: haste we, Diomed,

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the plains.
speaker: AGAMEMNON
line: To reinforcement, or we perish all.

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the plains.
speaker: NESTOR
line: Go, bear Patroclus' body to Achilles;

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the plains.
speaker: NESTOR
line: And bid the snail-paced Ajax arm for shame.

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the plains.
speaker: NESTOR
line: There is a thousand Hectors in the field:

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the plains.
speaker: NESTOR
line: Now here he fights on Galathe his horse,

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the plains.
speaker: NESTOR
line: And there lacks work; anon he's there afoot,

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the plains.
speaker: NESTOR
line: And there they fly or die, like scaled sculls

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the plains.
speaker: NESTOR
line: Before the belching whale; then is he yonder,

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the plains.
speaker: NESTOR
line: And there the strawy Greeks, ripe for his edge,

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the plains.
speaker: NESTOR
line: Fall down before him, like the mower's swath:

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the plains.
speaker: NESTOR
line: Here, there, and every where, he leaves and takes,

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the plains.
speaker: NESTOR
line: Dexterity so obeying appetite

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the plains.
speaker: NESTOR
line: That what he will he does, and does so much

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the plains.
speaker: NESTOR
line: That proof is call'd impossibility.

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the plains.
speaker: ULYSSES
line: O, courage, courage, princes! great Achilles

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the plains.
speaker: ULYSSES
line: Is arming, weeping, cursing, vowing vengeance:

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the plains.
speaker: ULYSSES
line: Patroclus' wounds have roused his drowsy blood,

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the plains.
speaker: ULYSSES
line: Together with his mangled Myrmidons,

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the plains.
speaker: ULYSSES
line: That noseless, handless, hack'd and chipp'd, come to him,

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the plains.
speaker: ULYSSES
line: Crying on Hector. Ajax hath lost a friend

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the plains.
speaker: ULYSSES
line: And foams at mouth, and he is arm'd and at it,

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the plains.
speaker: ULYSSES
line: Roaring for Troilus, who hath done to-day

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the plains.
speaker: ULYSSES
line: Mad and fantastic execution,

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the plains.
speaker: ULYSSES
line: Engaging and redeeming of himself

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the plains.
speaker: ULYSSES
line: With such a careless force and forceless care

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the plains.
speaker: ULYSSES
line: As if that luck, in very spite of cunning,

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the plains.
speaker: ULYSSES
line: Bade him win all.

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the plains.
speaker: AJAX
line: Troilus! thou coward Troilus!

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the plains.
speaker: DIOMEDES
line: Ay, there, there.

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the plains.
speaker: NESTOR
line: So, so, we draw together.

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the plains.
speaker: ACHILLES
line: Where is this Hector?

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the plains.
speaker: ACHILLES
line: Come, come, thou boy-queller, show thy face;

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the plains.
speaker: ACHILLES
line: Know what it is to meet Achilles angry:

scene: SCENE V.  Another part of the plains.
speaker: ACHILLES
line: Hector? where's Hector? I will none but Hector.

scene: SCENE VI.  Another part of the plains.
speaker: AJAX
line: Troilus, thou coward Troilus, show thy head!

scene: SCENE VI.  Another part of the plains.
speaker: DIOMEDES
line: Troilus, I say! where's Troilus?

scene: SCENE VI.  Another part of the plains.
speaker: AJAX
line: What wouldst thou?

scene: SCENE VI.  Another part of the plains.
speaker: DIOMEDES
line: I would correct him.

scene: SCENE VI.  Another part of the plains.
speaker: AJAX
line: Were I the general, thou shouldst have my office

scene: SCENE VI.  Another part of the plains.
speaker: AJAX
line: Ere that correction. Troilus, I say! what, Troilus!

scene: SCENE VI.  Another part of the plains.
speaker: TROILUS
line: O traitor Diomed! turn thy false face, thou traitor,

scene: SCENE VI.  Another part of the plains.
speaker: TROILUS
line: And pay thy life thou owest me for my horse!

scene: SCENE VI.  Another part of the plains.
speaker: DIOMEDES
line: Ha, art thou there?

scene: SCENE VI.  Another part of the plains.
speaker: AJAX
line: I'll fight with him alone: stand, Diomed.

scene: SCENE VI.  Another part of the plains.
speaker: DIOMEDES
line: He is my prize; I will not look upon.

scene: SCENE VI.  Another part of the plains.
speaker: TROILUS
line: Come, both you cogging Greeks; have at you both!

scene: SCENE VI.  Another part of the plains.
speaker: HECTOR
line: Yea, Troilus? O, well fought, my youngest brother!

scene: SCENE VI.  Another part of the plains.
speaker: ACHILLES
line: Now do I see thee, ha! have at thee, Hector!

scene: SCENE VI.  Another part of the plains.
speaker: HECTOR
line: Pause, if thou wilt.

scene: SCENE VI.  Another part of the plains.
speaker: ACHILLES
line: I do disdain thy courtesy, proud Trojan:

scene: SCENE VI.  Another part of the plains.
speaker: ACHILLES
line: Be happy that my arms are out of use:

scene: SCENE VI.  Another part of the plains.
speaker: ACHILLES
line: My rest and negligence befriends thee now,

scene: SCENE VI.  Another part of the plains.
speaker: ACHILLES
line: But thou anon shalt hear of me again;

scene: SCENE VI.  Another part of the plains.
speaker: ACHILLES
line: Till when, go seek thy fortune.

scene: SCENE VI.  Another part of the plains.
speaker: HECTOR
line: Fare thee well:

scene: SCENE VI.  Another part of the plains.
speaker: HECTOR
line: I would have been much more a fresher man,

scene: SCENE VI.  Another part of the plains.
speaker: HECTOR
line: Had I expected thee. How now, my brother!

scene: SCENE VI.  Another part of the plains.
speaker: TROILUS
line: Ajax hath ta'en AEneas: shall it be?

scene: SCENE VI.  Another part of the plains.
speaker: TROILUS
line: No, by the flame of yonder glorious heaven,

scene: SCENE VI.  Another part of the plains.
speaker: TROILUS
line: He shall not carry him: I'll be ta'en too,

scene: SCENE VI.  Another part of the plains.
speaker: TROILUS
line: Or bring him off: fate, hear me what I say!

scene: SCENE VI.  Another part of the plains.
speaker: TROILUS
line: I reck not though I end my life to-day.

scene: SCENE VI.  Another part of the plains.
speaker: HECTOR
line: Stand, stand, thou Greek; thou art a goodly mark:

scene: SCENE VI.  Another part of the plains.
speaker: HECTOR
line: No? wilt thou not? I like thy armour well;

scene: SCENE VI.  Another part of the plains.
speaker: HECTOR
line: I'll frush it and unlock the rivets all,

scene: SCENE VI.  Another part of the plains.
speaker: HECTOR
line: But I'll be master of it: wilt thou not,

scene: SCENE VI.  Another part of the plains.
speaker: HECTOR
line: beast, abide?

scene: SCENE VI.  Another part of the plains.
speaker: HECTOR
line: Why, then fly on, I'll hunt thee for thy hide.

scene: SCENE VII.  Another part of the plains.
speaker: ACHILLES
line: Come here about me, you my Myrmidons;

scene: SCENE VII.  Another part of the plains.
speaker: ACHILLES
line: Mark what I say. Attend me where I wheel:

scene: SCENE VII.  Another part of the plains.
speaker: ACHILLES
line: Strike not a stroke, but keep yourselves in breath:

scene: SCENE VII.  Another part of the plains.
speaker: ACHILLES
line: And when I have the bloody Hector found,

scene: SCENE VII.  Another part of the plains.
speaker: ACHILLES
line: Empale him with your weapons round about;

scene: SCENE VII.  Another part of the plains.
speaker: ACHILLES
line: In fellest manner execute your aims.

scene: SCENE VII.  Another part of the plains.
speaker: ACHILLES
line: Follow me, sirs, and my proceedings eye:

scene: SCENE VII.  Another part of the plains.
speaker: ACHILLES
line: It is decreed Hector the great must die.

scene: SCENE VII.  Another part of the plains.
speaker: THERSITES
line: The cuckold and the cuckold-maker are at it. Now,

scene: SCENE VII.  Another part of the plains.
speaker: THERSITES
line: bull! now, dog! 'Loo, Paris, 'loo! now my double-

scene: SCENE VII.  Another part of the plains.
speaker: THERSITES
line: henned sparrow! 'loo, Paris, 'loo! The bull has the

scene: SCENE VII.  Another part of the plains.
speaker: THERSITES
line: game: ware horns, ho!

scene: SCENE VII.  Another part of the plains.
speaker: MARGARELON
line: Turn, slave, and fight.

scene: SCENE VII.  Another part of the plains.
speaker: THERSITES
line: What art thou?

scene: SCENE VII.  Another part of the plains.
speaker: MARGARELON
line: A bastard son of Priam's.

scene: SCENE VII.  Another part of the plains.
speaker: THERSITES
line: I am a bastard too; I love bastards: I am a bastard

scene: SCENE VII.  Another part of the plains.
speaker: THERSITES
line: begot, bastard instructed, bastard in mind, bastard

scene: SCENE VII.  Another part of the plains.
speaker: THERSITES
line: in valour, in every thing illegitimate. One bear will

scene: SCENE VII.  Another part of the plains.
speaker: THERSITES
line: not bite another, and wherefore should one bastard?

scene: SCENE VII.  Another part of the plains.
speaker: THERSITES
line: Take heed, the quarrel's most ominous to us: if the

scene: SCENE VII.  Another part of the plains.
speaker: THERSITES
line: son of a whore fight for a whore, he tempts judgment:

scene: SCENE VII.  Another part of the plains.
speaker: THERSITES
line: farewell, bastard.

scene: SCENE VII.  Another part of the plains.
speaker: MARGARELON
line: The devil take thee, coward!

scene: SCENE VIII.  Another part of the plains.
speaker: HECTOR
line: Most putrefied core, so fair without,

scene: SCENE VIII.  Another part of the plains.
speaker: HECTOR
line: Thy goodly armour thus hath cost thy life.

scene: SCENE VIII.  Another part of the plains.
speaker: HECTOR
line: Now is my day's work done; I'll take good breath:

scene: SCENE VIII.  Another part of the plains.
speaker: HECTOR
line: Rest, sword; thou hast thy fill of blood and death.

scene: SCENE VIII.  Another part of the plains.
speaker: ACHILLES
line: Look, Hector, how the sun begins to set;

scene: SCENE VIII.  Another part of the plains.
speaker: ACHILLES
line: How ugly night comes breathing at his heels:

scene: SCENE VIII.  Another part of the plains.
speaker: ACHILLES
line: Even with the vail and darking of the sun,

scene: SCENE VIII.  Another part of the plains.
speaker: ACHILLES
line: To close the day up, Hector's life is done.

scene: SCENE VIII.  Another part of the plains.
speaker: HECTOR
line: I am unarm'd; forego this vantage, Greek.

scene: SCENE VIII.  Another part of the plains.
speaker: ACHILLES
line: Strike, fellows, strike; this is the man I seek.

scene: SCENE VIII.  Another part of the plains.
speaker: ACHILLES
line: So, Ilion, fall thou next! now, Troy, sink down!

scene: SCENE VIII.  Another part of the plains.
speaker: ACHILLES
line: Here lies thy heart, thy sinews, and thy bone.

scene: SCENE VIII.  Another part of the plains.
speaker: ACHILLES
line: On, Myrmidons, and cry you all amain,

scene: SCENE VIII.  Another part of the plains.
speaker: ACHILLES
line: 'Achilles hath the mighty Hector slain.'

scene: SCENE VIII.  Another part of the plains.
speaker: ACHILLES
line: Hark! a retire upon our Grecian part.

scene: SCENE VIII.  Another part of the plains.
speaker: MYRMIDONS
line: The Trojan trumpets sound the like, my lord.

scene: SCENE VIII.  Another part of the plains.
speaker: ACHILLES
line: The dragon wing of night o'erspreads the earth,

scene: SCENE VIII.  Another part of the plains.
speaker: ACHILLES
line: And, stickler-like, the armies separates.

scene: SCENE VIII.  Another part of the plains.
speaker: ACHILLES
line: My half-supp'd sword, that frankly would have fed,

scene: SCENE VIII.  Another part of the plains.
speaker: ACHILLES
line: Pleased with this dainty bait, thus goes to bed.

scene: SCENE VIII.  Another part of the plains.
speaker: ACHILLES
line: Come, tie his body to my horse's tail;

scene: SCENE VIII.  Another part of the plains.
speaker: ACHILLES
line: Along the field I will the Trojan trail.

scene: SCENE IX.  Another part of the plains.
speaker: AGAMEMNON
line: Hark! hark! what shout is that?

scene: SCENE IX.  Another part of the plains.
speaker: NESTOR
line: Peace, drums!

scene: SCENE IX.  Another part of the plains.
speaker: NESTOR
line: Achilles! Achilles! Hector's slain! Achilles.

scene: SCENE IX.  Another part of the plains.
speaker: DIOMEDES
line: The bruit is, Hector's slain, and by Achilles.

scene: SCENE IX.  Another part of the plains.
speaker: AJAX
line: If it be so, yet bragless let it be;

scene: SCENE IX.  Another part of the plains.
speaker: AJAX
line: Great Hector was a man as good as he.

scene: SCENE IX.  Another part of the plains.
speaker: AGAMEMNON
line: March patiently along: let one be sent

scene: SCENE IX.  Another part of the plains.
speaker: AGAMEMNON
line: To pray Achilles see us at our tent.

scene: SCENE IX.  Another part of the plains.
speaker: AGAMEMNON
line: If in his death the gods have us befriended,

scene: SCENE IX.  Another part of the plains.
speaker: AGAMEMNON
line: Great Troy is ours, and our sharp wars are ended.

scene: SCENE X.  Another part of the plains.
speaker: AENEAS
line: Stand, ho! yet are we masters of the field:

scene: SCENE X.  Another part of the plains.
speaker: AENEAS
line: Never go home; here starve we out the night.

scene: SCENE X.  Another part of the plains.
speaker: TROILUS
line: Hector is slain.

scene: SCENE X.  Another part of the plains.
speaker: ALL
line: Hector! the gods forbid!

scene: SCENE X.  Another part of the plains.
speaker: TROILUS
line: He's dead; and at the murderer's horse's tail,

scene: SCENE X.  Another part of the plains.
speaker: TROILUS
line: In beastly sort, dragg'd through the shameful field.

scene: SCENE X.  Another part of the plains.
speaker: TROILUS
line: Frown on, you heavens, effect your rage with speed!

scene: SCENE X.  Another part of the plains.
speaker: TROILUS
line: Sit, gods, upon your thrones, and smile at Troy!

scene: SCENE X.  Another part of the plains.
speaker: TROILUS
line: I say, at once let your brief plagues be mercy,

scene: SCENE X.  Another part of the plains.
speaker: TROILUS
line: And linger not our sure destructions on!

scene: SCENE X.  Another part of the plains.
speaker: AENEAS
line: My lord, you do discomfort all the host!

scene: SCENE X.  Another part of the plains.
speaker: TROILUS
line: You understand me not that tell me so:

scene: SCENE X.  Another part of the plains.
speaker: TROILUS
line: I do not speak of flight, of fear, of death,

scene: SCENE X.  Another part of the plains.
speaker: TROILUS
line: But dare all imminence that gods and men

scene: SCENE X.  Another part of the plains.
speaker: TROILUS
line: Address their dangers in. Hector is gone:

scene: SCENE X.  Another part of the plains.
speaker: TROILUS
line: Who shall tell Priam so, or Hecuba?

scene: SCENE X.  Another part of the plains.
speaker: TROILUS
line: Let him that will a screech-owl aye be call'd,

scene: SCENE X.  Another part of the plains.
speaker: TROILUS
line: Go in to Troy, and say there, Hector's dead:

scene: SCENE X.  Another part of the plains.
speaker: TROILUS
line: There is a word will Priam turn to stone;

scene: SCENE X.  Another part of the plains.
speaker: TROILUS
line: Make wells and Niobes of the maids and wives,

scene: SCENE X.  Another part of the plains.
speaker: TROILUS
line: Cold statues of the youth, and, in a word,

scene: SCENE X.  Another part of the plains.
speaker: TROILUS
line: Scare Troy out of itself. But, march away:

scene: SCENE X.  Another part of the plains.
speaker: TROILUS
line: Hector is dead; there is no more to say.

scene: SCENE X.  Another part of the plains.
speaker: TROILUS
line: Stay yet. You vile abominable tents,

scene: SCENE X.  Another part of the plains.
speaker: TROILUS
line: Thus proudly pight upon our Phrygian plains,

scene: SCENE X.  Another part of the plains.
speaker: TROILUS
line: Let Titan rise as early as he dare,

scene: SCENE X.  Another part of the plains.
speaker: TROILUS
line: I'll through and through you! and, thou great-sized coward,

scene: SCENE X.  Another part of the plains.
speaker: TROILUS
line: No space of earth shall sunder our two hates:

scene: SCENE X.  Another part of the plains.
speaker: TROILUS
line: I'll haunt thee like a wicked conscience still,

scene: SCENE X.  Another part of the plains.
speaker: TROILUS
line: That mouldeth goblins swift as frenzy's thoughts.

scene: SCENE X.  Another part of the plains.
speaker: TROILUS
line: Strike a free march to Troy! with comfort go:

scene: SCENE X.  Another part of the plains.
speaker: TROILUS
line: Hope of revenge shall hide our inward woe.

scene: SCENE X.  Another part of the plains.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: But hear you, hear you!

scene: SCENE X.  Another part of the plains.
speaker: TROILUS
line: Hence, broker-lackey! ignomy and shame

scene: SCENE X.  Another part of the plains.
speaker: TROILUS
line: Pursue thy life, and live aye with thy name!

scene: SCENE X.  Another part of the plains.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: A goodly medicine for my aching bones! O world!

scene: SCENE X.  Another part of the plains.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: world! world! thus is the poor agent despised!

scene: SCENE X.  Another part of the plains.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: O traitors and bawds, how earnestly are you set

scene: SCENE X.  Another part of the plains.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: a-work, and how ill requited! why should our

scene: SCENE X.  Another part of the plains.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: endeavour be so loved and the performance so loathed?

scene: SCENE X.  Another part of the plains.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: what verse for it? what instance for it? Let me see:

scene: SCENE X.  Another part of the plains.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: Full merrily the humble-bee doth sing,

scene: SCENE X.  Another part of the plains.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: Till he hath lost his honey and his sting;

scene: SCENE X.  Another part of the plains.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: And being once subdued in armed tail,

scene: SCENE X.  Another part of the plains.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: Sweet honey and sweet notes together fail.

scene: SCENE X.  Another part of the plains.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: Good traders in the flesh, set this in your

scene: SCENE X.  Another part of the plains.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: painted cloths.

scene: SCENE X.  Another part of the plains.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: As many as be here of pander's hall,

scene: SCENE X.  Another part of the plains.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: Your eyes, half out, weep out at Pandar's fall;

scene: SCENE X.  Another part of the plains.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: Or if you cannot weep, yet give some groans,

scene: SCENE X.  Another part of the plains.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: Though not for me, yet for your aching bones.

scene: SCENE X.  Another part of the plains.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: Brethren and sisters of the hold-door trade,

scene: SCENE X.  Another part of the plains.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: Some two months hence my will shall here be made:

scene: SCENE X.  Another part of the plains.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: It should be now, but that my fear is this,

scene: SCENE X.  Another part of the plains.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: Some galled goose of Winchester would hiss:

scene: SCENE X.  Another part of the plains.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: Till then I'll sweat and seek about for eases,

scene: SCENE X.  Another part of the plains.
speaker: PANDARUS
line: And at that time bequeathe you my diseases.
